Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Al-Bukhary
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the last of the science of medicine, it seems to me that by its completion and explanation, I fulfill my promise to you with this treatise on surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because the practice of surgery is almost unknown in our region and time, it is feared that this science will be lost, its traces will disappear, and only a few small descriptions will remain in the books of the Ancients. But these are obscure and their meaning is difficult to understand.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it seems to me that I should revive this with a treatise arranged in such a way as to explain, clarify and abbreviate; and also include illustrations of the forms of cautery tools and other instruments used in the operation, both for addition to the explanation and preparation of the subject matter.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the reason why skilled surgeons are not found in our time is that the art of medicine is lengthy and requires its practitioner to be well versed in the science of anatomy before attempting surgery. One must know the arrangement of the limbs, the forms of their joints and separations; the number and function of bones, nerves, and ligaments; and the location of arterial and venous pulsation points.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	"Thus says Hippocrates that in name it is small, but in work it is great, especially in the art of the hand."
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	"But we have already spoken of this at the beginning of this book; for whoever does not know what we have said about anatomy will not avoid falling into error which often causes the death of men, as I have seen too many times, since some are formed in this science but lack knowledge and experience."
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	"I saw a foolish and inexperienced physician who incised an aphemphous abscess on the neck of a woman, cutting some arteries in the process, causing so much blood to flow that the woman suddenly died between her sheets."
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	"And I saw another physician who, shortly after removing a stone from a man in his urinary state, and the stone was large, he tore part of the bladder with it, causing that man to die on the third day."
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	"And I had already warned him not to do so, and I saw that because of the size of the stone and the state of the illness, I knew right away that he would die."
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	"And I saw another physician who received payment of one ducat from our land for surgery, and he came to treat a black man who had a broken thighbone. And through his ignorance, the physician put splints on it with bandages and braces too tightly, not allowing space for respiration."
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	"And he released him according to his desires, and then left him, leaving him like that for some days and ordering that the bandages not be removed. And thus it was until the thighbone and flesh became putrid, resulting in harm."
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	"And I was called to him, and I prepared to remove the bandages, and thus tranquility returned and he recovered from his pain."
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	"But however, corruption had already become established in the member, so that I could not prevent it, and corruption did not cease to wander through the member until the patient died."
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	"And I saw another physician who punctured a cancerous boil, and it became ulcerated some days later, during which time the evil of it increased with the patient."
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	"The reason is that black bile is pure of humor, so it should not be cauterized with fire at all, but rather it should be treated with members which suffer from heat."
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	"And for that reason, my children, it is necessary that the operation be divided into two parts: one is the operation which is associated with health, and one is the work in which there is danger in the greatest dispositions."
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	"And I have already spoken about this in all parts of this book where operation is mentioned which contains error and fear. Therefore, it is necessary for you to observe this and leave that, so that the foolish may not find an opportunity to speak and dishonor you."
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	"And therefore take your weapons with solicitude and protection from God, and your illnesses with patience and firmness."
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	"And use the best way through the grace of God to achieve salvation and blessed success, and leave behind terrible illnesses of difficult healing, and bear your weapons against that which causes you fear, so that you may not waver in your faith and in your name: for more remains to your glory, both here and hereafter, and your sanctity."
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	"Because it has already been said in some of my books:"
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	"'Do not treat an illness that you do not know, lest you be called a bad physician.'"
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	"And I have already divided this book according to three chapters."
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	"Begin the division of the book, and first of the first part."
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	"The first chapter deals with the head in its forms of instruments and cautery irons, and what is necessary for the operation."
La divisio de la segonda partida.	"The division of the second part."
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The second chapter, on stitching and puncturing, leeching, cupping, extracting arrows and similar things, all organized according to the forms of instruments."
Divisio de la tersa partida.	"Division of the third part."
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	"The third chapter, on reduction and dislocation, and the cure of torsion and similar things; this chapter deals with the head in its weights and forms of instruments."
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	"On cautery by fire and sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation."
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	"And with that begins the treatise of this entire book."
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	"It is necessary for me to say what are the virtues of that cautery and its harms, and in which complexion cautery is prohibited."
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	"Therefore I say that the discourse on the virtue of cautery and its harm is long and prolix, subtle in science, and secretly hidden; many wise men have already spoken about it, and they disagree among themselves, and it suffices me to mention a little of their discourses for fear of lengthiness."
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	"And therefore I say that cautery confers benefit to all complexions universally, whether they have matter or not, except for two complexions which are without matter."
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	"In the complexion that is cold and dry with matter there will be disagreement; for some say that cautery is beneficial to it, and others say the contrary, that cautery is not suitable for an illness that is caused by quality and dryness, because nature of fire is heat and dryness, and it is not fitting that an illness that is cold and dry with matter should be healed with something hot and dry."
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	"And he who says the contrary of this, that cautery brings benefit to all cold and dry illnesses that occur in men's bodies, for when you compare the body of man and its humidity with the complexion of fire, you find the body of man inferior."
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	"And I say according to what he says, that experience has already proven this to me on several occasions."
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	"But nevertheless it is not necessary to elaborate on this subject that has already been discussed and exercised in the chapter on cautery at length, and after having studied the diversity of complexion in men and the disposition of illnesses in their members, their causes, accidents, and the space of time for each."
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	"But in other complexions there is no cause for fear, especially in hot and humid illnesses, because all physicians agree on these and are not in disagreement about the benefit of cautery in them."
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	"And know, my son, that the secret of curing by fire cautery and its goodness consists in cautery with combustible medicine, because fire is simple and its action only reaches to the member being cauterized, and does not reach another member nearby except with slight harm."
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	"But the action of combustible medicine reaches to that which it touches, and strong heat can bring about an illness in a nearby member that is difficult to heal, and strong heat also exits."
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	"But fire, because of its sublimity and goodness of substance, does not do anything except superfluously. And this is already known to us through experience and long study of the art with regard to the truth of causes; and for this reason I am excused from lengthening the discussion. And if it were not that my book has not yet been read in this place, you would find hidden here a secret about fire and the quality of its operation in bodies and its expulsion by which illnesses are expelled, demonstrated with philosophical speech, which would sharpen your understanding."
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	"And know, my son, that they disagree about the time when it is appropriate to perform cautery and they place the best time in spring."
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	"I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the harm caused by accidental time is submerged in the judgment of that which is drawn with the cautery, and even more if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong and fixed, which do not tolerate delay because it is feared from those that come malice, which is greater than small entering harm."
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	"And do not count on yourselves, O children, for that is not esteemed by the common people and foolish doctors, since it is believed that any illness that is healed by cautery is a lasting remedy, and they pause at that consequence."
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	"And the cause is not as they believe because cautery is only a substitute for medicine which alters the complexion and dries out the humors, which are the cause of pains."
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	"But however, cautery is superfluous over medicine because of the will of its virtue and operation and the greatness of its Lord."
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	"And it is possible that his illness will return at some time in the future, depending on the complexion of the sick person and the location of their illness, and its virtue and what is prepared in their body from the accumulation of superfluities therein, and what they have acquired through food and similar causes; but if an illness for which cautery has been administered is a subtle one in a member with few superfluities and humors, like cautery of teeth for pain or similar things, it is possible that this pain will not return, but it is done little."
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	"And more commonly it is said that cautery is the last resort of medicine, and this saying is true, for they believe that there is no cure that profits either with medicine or with any other cause besides cautery."
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	"And the reason is contrary to that; and the intention that cautery is the last resort of medicine is only when other remedies have been tried in certain illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and therefore cautery is administered at the end, and it profits for that."
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	"And here it is said that cautery is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention understood by the common people and many foolish doctors."
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	"And the ancients said that cautery with gold is better than cautery with iron, and they did not say this except for the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance."
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	"And they said that the place of cautery does not make a scar, which is not absolutely true, for I have seen and proven that this is only so in certain bodies without others, and cautery with gold is good and better than with iron as they said; but nevertheless when you heat cautery with fire with gold it is not declared to you, because it ignites according to the quantity you want due to the roughness of gold, and prepares to receive a burn; and if you adjust the ignition it melts the gold by the fire, and some sheets fall into the fire so that the artist catches them in his occupation."
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	"And for this reason cautery with iron is done more lightly and more gently with regard to the correctness of the operation."
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	"And I have already ordered this chapter on cautery according to chapters, and those of the head within the weights, so that later when asking for something from it you may easily find what you want."
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	"On cautery for headache due to coldness and humidity."
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery confers upon the skin humidity and coldness; its accidental cause is due to two things: namely, heat and excessive flow of phlegm, called catarrh, which flows from the head down to the eyes and ears, causing excessive sleepiness, toothache and throat pain, and generally speaking, all diseases that arise from coldness, such as paralysis, apoplexy, etc., and similar ones.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	Firstly, you should command the patient to purge with a laxative medicine for three or four nights, depending on what you judge appropriate according to the severity of their illness and their age and constitution.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to shave his head with a razor, and have him sit on a large bench covered with a sheet, with his face turned upwards.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then place the cautery of your palm just above the tip of their nose between their eyebrows.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But first, when you have arrived at that point with your finger, mark it with a pen and then light the olive-oil cautery which is in this shape:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	Then place it on the marked spot so that it descends gently, pressing down little by little until you feel the heat. Then twist it slowly back and forth.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then lift your hand gently and observe the spot; if you see that some of the bone is already exposed, like a grain of barley, then lift your hand. If not, return your hand with the iron, using another one if it has cooled down, until you see what I have told you to look for.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	Then take a little salt and dissolve it on the spot, leaving it there for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then place around the edges of the wound and leave it on until the burn scar has healed completely.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the spot with a fourfold remedy so that it may be healed."
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	"And they said that whenever the plague breaks out, it is better to tie one's arms tightly, for it brings greater relief and healing."
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	"And some of them said that the spine should be cauterized within the bone, and that the cautery should be held there until some part of the spinal marrow is adhered."
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	"Then scrape off what has adhered to the bone, and then treat it."
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	"And others said that when the cautery reaches the end, it should press strongly onto the bone until the bone cracks, and this is the form of a small alfecati."
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	"And they believe that from that spot the vapors of the head expire."
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	"And let the plague remain untreated for a long time, and then treat it so that it may be consolidated."
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	"But I have not seen these two kinds of cauteries performed entirely, but only in some men due to fear; and that one, it seems to me, is better with health when present, for the head is dilated by solution of continuity from this same cause as we have testified regarding other members, and even more so when the head of the sick person is of a hot nature."
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	"And the first kind of cautery is safer and better, in my opinion; and with that instrument and that procedure one has health."
Capitol segon.	"Chapter Two."
Del cauteri del cap.	"On cauterizing the head."
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	"When there is chronic and long-lasting pain in the whole head and this persists for a prolonged period of illness, and various remedies are used such as bandages, poultices, compresses, plaster casts, ointments, decoctions, poultices made from plants or animal parts, and similar things, especially if it has already been cauterized with a cautery that does not help much due to those causes, then consider whether the head of the sick person is of strong constitution in its nature; and if it is not hotter than usual, then cauterize it with another cautery at another place near that one."
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	"And similarly cauterize it on the horn of his head with a cautery until the bone is broken."
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	"Cut the bone and expose it to the quantity we have mentioned, and cauterize there with a cautery at the last part of the head where it is called 'vagus', which is the place where cupping is performed."
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	"And be gentle in this matter and do not expose the bone, for the illness suffers great pain from this different from the pain of all other cauteries on the head."
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And I say this cautery in its place, for it is necessary to cauterize with the cautery that one uses to cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput, which is a more subtle cautery than that used to cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is its form."
Capitol ters.	"Chapter Three."
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	"On cauterizing chronic migraine."
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	"When there is sudden pain in the part of the head or a stabbing pain within it, evacuate with medications that cleanse the head and administer the other treatment which I have mentioned in the remedies for illnesses; and if nothing helps, then cauterize in two ways: either with a caustic medication that burns, or with iron."
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	"The better cautery with burning medication is this: take some aloe and scrape it and cut off both its heads."
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	"And then incise the location of the pain in the temple with a sharp lancet until you reach the bone beneath it."
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	"And then press it with a tight bandage for several hours, and leave it alone for three hours; then remove the bandage and remove the aloe, leaving the wound open for two or three days; then bathe the surrounding area with warm water until the location becomes moist."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with ointment until it is healed."
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	"If you wish, do this with some caustic medications which I have written about in the second book of caustic medicines."
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"The better cautery with iron is done in this way: heat the cautery which has this shape:"
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	"and it is called 'closed nails', for its head is like the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in the middle of it there is a small prominence."
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	"And then place it on the location of the pain, and hold your hand steady so that the heat does not adhere to the cautery which is underneath; and slowly rotate the hot iron with speed."
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	"And if the quantity of it that adheres to the bone is thus much, lift your hand up so that the artery below does not adhere, lest blood flow."
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then immerse the area in salt water and place it there, leaving it alone for three days; then bathe the area with warm water, and treat it with ointment until it is healed."
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	"And if you wish, cauterize with the point of a knife according to cautery, and beware of incising an artery in this chronic migraine properly."
Capitol quart.	"Chapter Four."
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	"On cauterizing acute migraine."
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	"When you treat migraine with what we have said about the previous treatment and what we have mentioned in the divisions of illnesses, and if the treatment does not help, and the illness is such that it does not reach what we have said about the first cautery with medication or with fire, then heat the knife cautery until it is red hot, and place your hand on the location of the pain with a line of its length, and press it there until you incise the artery and enter to the bone."
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	"However, it is necessary for you to beware of the continuation of the mandible, which is moved by chewing, and that the muscle is not adhered to and the nerves that move it, and that spasms do not occur."
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	"And if it is about the caution and care of blood flow from the artery that is opened, for there is fear in its opening, especially for him who does not know what he is doing and is not studious and experienced; leave the operation at the beginning."
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	"And I will bring to mind the regimen of accidental bleeding from an artery according to its manner, in its place in this book."
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	"And if you see that this illness does not benefit from this cautery and that the patient can tolerate it, cauterize him in the middle of his head as we have told, and treat the wound until it is healed."
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	"And if you wish, administer the cautery which we have mentioned in the chapter on tying an artery with cautery having two points, for this is better cautery and more effective."
Capitol .v.	"Chapter Five."
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	"On cauterizing earaches."
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	"When there is pain in the ear due to friction and it is treated with laxative causes and other treatments that have been mentioned in the division, but the pain is not removed, then heat the cautery, which is called 'punctum' and has this shape:"
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	"And then prick it at the ignition point and lead it around the entire ear like a wheel is turned, or around each prominence if the pain is in each one."
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	"Be careful with the cautery of the ear's opening little by little because you have felt the location with its tip."
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	"And if you make ten points in all the ear and quit it, then treat those locations until they are healed."
Capitol .vi.	"Chapter Six."
De cauterizacio de turtura.	"On cauterizing tortures."
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	"The torture that is treated with cautery is only of those species that come from phlegm, according to what we have said in the divisions of diseases."
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	"Evade cauterization of the species that occurs through dryness or spasm of the nerve."
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	"When you treat that species of tortura with herbs and capipurgi and gargarisms, and yet you cannot confirm your treatment, then you should cauterize the patient with three cauteries: one at the root of the ear, the second a little behind the cheekbone, and the third at the junction of two lips."
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	"And place your cautery on the opposite side from where the ailment began, for softening is seen only in the part that seems healed."
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	"And the manner of cauterization is that you should cauterize it with the cautery on the right side of the extreme tip of the ear, a little above the horn of the head, and another on the cheekbone, its length being equal to the length of the thumb, and then place your hand with the cautery until most of the surface area of the wound is burned."
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	"And this is the shape of the cautery, and it is a specialty of the barber-surgeon, the shape of which is shown on this table."
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	"Although perhaps it may seem too subtle to you, yet in place of unnecessary roughness it is better to cut a little."
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	"And then cure the wound with what is denoted as processed before until it is healed."
Capitol .vii.	"Chapter VII."
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	"On the cautery of ancient apoplexy."
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	"When apoplexy is ancient and you cure it with what we have said and your medication does not work and the ailment has no fever, then cauterize those places with four cauteries: on all the horns of its head; and a cautery in the middle of the head, as we have said; and a cautery behind the ear."
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	"And the manner of the cautery is made according to what has been said above."
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	"After it has been cauterized over the mouth of the stomach, and if it is worse, then it should be cured with what you process."
Capitol .viii.	"Chapter VIII."
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	Burns caused by forgetfulness are treated with flame cautery.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	"Great quantities of pills are given to the patient at the beginning, serving to cleanse."
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	"And then immediately cover the entire head of the patient and place on it the plaster described in the treatise on plasters."
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	"And apply this several times, for this is a manner of cautery."
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	"And do this according to that method already mentioned."
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	"If this does not heal well, then make three cauteries in the last section of their head, which should be descending from the most elevated part of the head towards the lowest part of the neck."
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	"And place between each cautery the thickness of a finger, and immediately cover the cautery with that which has been produced."
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	"But if the patient can tolerate it, then make a cautery in the middle; and if they want more, then cauterize those over both ears."
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	"Then cover that which has been healed; and let the cauteries be oval according to the form given above."
Capitol .ix.	Chapter IX
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	Of cauterization of paralysis and softening of the whole body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	"First, you shall proceed with the preparation of the head using herbs and the things we have mentioned. Then shave the head of the patient, and cauterize him in the middle of the head with a cautery. Also cauterize all around the horns of his head, and cauterize at the last part of it. And apply three cauteries on the spinal bones of the neck."
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	"If the illness of softening of the body is great and the patient cannot tolerate it, then cauterize him with four cauteries on the spinal bones of the back, and afterward cauterize within the hollow of his throat, and lift up his hands."
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	"And also cure that which is healed, and this shall be cauterized with an olive-oil cautery."
Capitol .x.	"Chapter X."
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	"On the cautery treatment of epilepsy."
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	It is not cauterized in the epileptic unless that epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	Therefore, it is necessary to cleanse the brain at the beginning of the disease and also in the other cure which we have spoken about in the division when the patient has a great deal of phlegm and is tolerant of medicine.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	And if it is a child who does not tolerate medicines, then administer gargarisms and masticatories to cleanse the throat, previously for several days, with good nutrition.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	And afterwards shave the head of the patient, and also cauterize him with one cautery in the middle of the head according to the previous manner, and with another cautery in the nape of his neck, and on each horn of the head cauterize also.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	And if the patient is strong and can tolerate it, then cauterize him with cauteries as mentioned before, having paralysis and relaxation of the body over the vertebrae of the neck and the vertebrae of the back.
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And use an olive-shaped cautery according to what has been described previously.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	But if the patient is a child, then pause cauterizing him with subtle cauteries in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	Chapter XI
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Of cautery for melancholy.
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted humidity and thick phlegm, then cauterize the patient with the cauteries that we have mentioned before, having paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is superfluous matter declining towards melancholy, and the body of the patient is humid, then let him drink water that cleanses the brain according to what has been mentioned before in the division.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	And also shave the head of the patient, and also make a suitable pigeon's egg of it on the circumference, and also leave that in the middle of the head.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	And let the patient lie down on his back, and let him be held from all parts.
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	And then apply a liniment; and afterwards it is worthy of anointing with wool grease.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat this over the fire for moderate warming by measure, which the patient can suffer when it is applied to him.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	And then put this in the middle of the head of the patient within the circle, and let it remain until it becomes cool.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	And do this with the patient once each week until it is healed; or if you wish, cauterize him with small punctures according to what suits him best, without having your hand close to a cautery arranged in this way: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain evenly.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then apply that ointment smeared on wool or on grease of lard.
Capitol .xii.	Chapter XII
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	"For cauterization of descending water in the heel."
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	"When you notice the start of water descent in the heel through the signs that I mentioned earlier in this section, then begin and give the patient something to drink which cleanses the head, and protect them from all humidity."
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	"And do that treatment in a bath for several days."
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	"And also order him to shave his head, and cauterize it with a cautery in the middle of the head; and also cauterize it with two cauteries over both temples if there is the beginning of descent of water in both heels, or on one side if it begins on one heel."
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	"Incise with a cautery all the veins and arteries which are below the elbow, and let the cauteries be placed at that distance level with the temples."
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	"And take care not to have flows of blood when cauterizing. And if you see any flow of blood from it, stop it with some medication, which is within your ability."
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	"And you should come with skill in extracting arteries and in excising them, and caution against flows of blood."
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	"Sometimes it is cauterized in the neck below two bones with two cauteries placed perpendicularly."
Capitol .xiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Of cautery for dried tears.
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	"When tears from the eyes are abundant and flow through veins and arteries in the visible area of the head, it is verified that this is excess fluid from bloody humors. Therefore, cauterize around the beginning of water entering the eyes with the cautery mentioned at the start of this chapter, and cauterize the middle of the head, two points on either side of the temples, and two points on either side of the jawbones."
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	"If additional cautery is needed, then cauterize the entire length of the eyebrow ridge above the eye with a small cautery."
Capitol .xiiii.	"Chapter XIV."
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	"Of cautery for foul odor from the nose."
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	"When you treat someone with the method described earlier and it does not improve, then prepare and give them to drink the decoction for three nights. After that, shave their head and cauterize the crown of the head with a mixture of cautery iron and olive oil."
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	"And also cauterize the middle of the forehead with clove cautery and two cauteries on either side of the eyebrows where the hair begins, each one a little smaller."
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	"And be careful not to burn the face with the cautery."
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	"Here is how to make clove cautery:"
Capitol .xv.	Capital Fifteen
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	About eyelid cauterization in cases of inflammation.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"When the eyelid is inflamed due to illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a lunar cautery."
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	"And if you, cauterize the two eyebrows each with two cauteries in total, and elongated from the temples."
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	"And let the length of each cautery be according to the quantity of the eyebrow."
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	"And do not press too hard on the cautery with your hand, but according to how much the third part of the eyelid is adhered."
Capitol .xvi.	Capítulo XVI
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	"Regarding cauterizing the eyelid when the hairs turn inward and pierce it."
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	"When the hairs of the eye turn inward so as to pierce it, there are two ways to cauterize them: either with fire or with a burning medicine."
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	"If you cauterize with fire, first tell the patient to pluck out his hairs as they are plucked for shaving, until they are lengthened and thickened; and if one of them touches their opening, then immediately close the eyes with a bandage so that it is not harmed until the hairs have grown."
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	"Then, when they have grown long and thickened, then pause the head of the patient on your thigh, and carefully place the cautery on the eyelid of the eye with the tip, shaped like a grass blade, at the beginning where the hairs are."
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	"And then place hot wax or dough made from ground barley or pitch on the eye."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	"And then light the cautery of which this is the shape:"
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	"And then cauterize along the shape that you have drawn, little by little, in several views, until the surface of the line that is like a myrtle leaf is completely burned."
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	"The sign of the completion of this procedure is that you see the eyelid of the eye already contracted and its hairs raised away from the puncture of the eye."
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	"And then raise your hand and leave it for three days, and then place cotton with a border over it until the scar has healed."
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	"And then dress it with ointment until it is healed."
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	"If some cause returns through the skin near their birthmark and the eyelid is swollen, then apply the cautery again in that same spot just as you did initially."
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	"If the hairs on the eyelid are growing outwards, then cauterize that area which is elevated to its natural place and sealed so that the hairs cannot stick out."
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"If the cautery with medicine burns you, then order the patient to apply the hairs which are lengthened and sealed, and nearby make a bandage of cloth in the shape of a miter leaf."
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	"And take some known soap and live coal together with a needle, and immediately mix those coals well, and do this with haste so that it does not cool down; then spread that onto the cloth which is made in the shape of a miter leaf, and place it over one eye or both; and place a cloth dipped in egg white over the other eye, keeping the head of the patient upright."
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	"And place your finger over the medicine and press it gently without moving until the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for that bite is like fire."
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	"And when you perceive that the bite has ceased, then remove the medicine with your finger; and when the bite stops, then rinse the eye with water. Then observe if the eyelid is lifted up as it should be after being washed away by the contraction with fire or incision, for then it will be good. And if not, then place the medicine again on the location where it did not stick previously until it becomes sealed and your operation is completed."
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	"And then place over that with a border until the chain of adhesion has been eradicated; and then heal it with a poultice or another remedy until it is healed."
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	"And it is necessary that you, after your operation, carefully guard that nothing falls into the eye from the medicine. And if the eyelid becomes inflamed after several days and some cause of hairs punches into the eye, then repeat your medicine over that location where the eyelid is inflamed; and particularly do this as you did at the beginning until it is healed."
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	"And this is the shape of a miter leaf."
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	"And know that the eyes of men are differentiated according to their size and smallness, and therefore your contraction is made accordingly."
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	"And do not reveal the way of rectitude to one who studies this art."
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Of the cauterization of a fistula that is in the lachrymal duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	"When you treat fistula as we've said in the divisions of illnesses and your treatment does not conform, then you must cauterize it in this manner: Command the patient to place their head on their knees, and have a servant hold their head between their thighs so that it is not moved nor agitated with their head."
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	"And then apply heat in the form of hot water or poultice of bird droppings onto the wound."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	"Now take the cautery of which this is the shape:"
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	"That is heated, like the shape of a reed or an eagle's feather, at one end with which you make the cautery."
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	"And if you wish, it should penetrate somewhat into the other extremity."
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	"And if you want, it should be sharp like a needle."
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	"But however that which is heated is better for your task."
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	"And then press the fistula with it if it is open, and draw out from it the sanies (pus) and dry it up."
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	"If it is not open, then apply that cautery there to make it so, and extract the pus from it."
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	"And then apply the cautery which has been well heated onto it, and with that hand hold it against the wound near the opening of the nostril to prevent your hand or the patient from being burned, and then apply the cautery onto the surface of the wound and destroy it."
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	"And then if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the bone, that is good. Otherwise, apply the cautery again once or twice as necessary, and leave it there for three days, and then apply a bandage around it with a drying ointment until it is healed."
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	"But if after twelve days it has not healed, then apply a caustic medicine to it until the bone is exposed and scrape it according to what you will find in its chapter."
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	"And another manner of cauterizing a fistula that some first said: Enter into the location of the fistula and make it hot, and then apply there gently with this form: Take as much melted lead as the length of your little finger. And with your hand hold it with good retention so that the molten lead does not fall onto the wound; and cover the wound of the patient with a cloth dipped in album of eggs or water, for the lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it by marvelous healing."
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	"And if the fistula has been healed by that which we have said about cauterization and cure, then that is good. Otherwise, it will be necessary to administer a probe through the nostril and reduce the fistula into the nasal cavity according to what will come in its proper place."
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On cauterizing the split in the buttocks.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	"Fissures occur frequently in the lips, especially in those of infants."
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	"So when you treat these fissures with what we have said in the divisions and it does not help, then immediately use a small cauterizing scalpel according to this form that is indicated:"
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	"And let its concavity be like the thinness of a knife blade."
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	"Approach carefully and place that cautery in those fissures until it reaches the bottom of them."
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	"And then cure it with wax until it is healed."
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Of the cautery of a fistula in the mouth
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When in the root of the uvula or on the palate or on the roots of the teeth an aposteme appears and it grows, and then bursts, and becomes ancient, and blood flows and a fistula is formed, and you treat that and it does not benefit from treatment, then it is necessary for you to heat cautery according to the amount received in the fistula, and put that heated one into the passage of the fistula, and keep your hand there until the hot iron reaches the bottom of it, and at the end of it do this once or twice; and then treat it with what we have said about treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And if the bone is separated and it heals, good; but if not, then it is necessary to uncover that place and remove the decayed bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	Chapter XX
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Of the cautery of teeth and softening of the gums
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by moisture and the teeth are painful, and you treat them with medicines but they do not improve, then place the head of the sick one on the chair, and heat the cautery in this form which will come later, so that you put the pincers over the tooth and quickly insert the heated cautery into it, keeping your hand there a little while until the sick one feels the heat of the fire reaching the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	And then remove your hand and repeat the cautery several times according to what you want.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	And then the sick one should rinse his mouth with salt water and hold it there for an hour, and afterwards spit that out, because the painful tooth is made firm and the softened gum is strengthened and the corrupt moisture is dried.
Capitol .xxi.	De fistulis que son en las dentz e de curacio d'ells.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	"For cauterization of tooth pain."
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	"When tooth pain is caused by coldness, or it's broken or worm-eaten, and medical treatment does not relieve the condition, then cauterization is applied in two ways: either with a hot iron brand from cattle, or by applying fire."
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	"Cauterization with a hot iron brand is done by taking the branding iron of cattle and heating it on coals, then quickly taking it out and wrapping it in cotton. Then you apply that heated brand to the painful tooth area without delay until it becomes numb."
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	"And repeat this several times until the heat reaches the root of the teeth."
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	"And if you wish, dip wool or cotton in the above-mentioned branding iron and place it on the painful tooth. Then place the heated iron on top of that until the iron reaches the entrance to the cavity of the tooth."
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	"But remember that cauterization with fire is dangerous and should be done with caution, ensuring the heat of the iron or coal does not reach the mouth of the patient."
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	"And then heat the cauterizing tool according to its shape, and place it on the tooth without touching your hand until it becomes numb. Do this several times a day until the pain is completely gone or has significantly decreased either that same day or the next."
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	"And it is necessary that after using this cauterization, the patient holds their mouth open with a good grip and keeps it like that for one hour, then spits. This is the form of cauterization."
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	"And cauterize whichever extremity you wish according to your ability."
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	"And this is the shape of the cannula:"
Capitol .xxii.	"Chapter XXII."
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	"Of cautery for external prolapse."
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	"When prolapse is caused by mucus and humors that are refractory to digestion despite medications, then you may attempt digestion of those substances lightly; however, if necessary, cauterize the prolapse using a cautery instrument shaped as follows: having two extremities bored through which smoke can exit during cauterization, pause the ignited end over the prolapse once or twice until it reaches its center."
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	"And if the prolapse is small, then pause the cautery according to its size, and leave it for three days, applying heat on its edges until what was burned by fire has healed."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	"Then apply that ointment and bandages so that it may heal."
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	"And the shape of the cautery instrument for such prolapse is as shown [in the illustration]:"
Capitol .xxiii.	"Chapter XXIII."
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	"On cauterization of the uvula and on the stricture of the anus."
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When excessive humidity comes upon the surface of the lung, especially if it's accompanied by coldness in the chest, then the patient should initially be treated with laxative medications and cautery applied on that part pressed by the collarbone.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And make sure to apply the cautery carefully so as not to burn the collarbone itself or its nerves.
