E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize another spot with another cautery at the junction of the collarbone and the last cervical vertebra.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery on it should be applied in the same manner as before.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with what has been prescribed until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Regarding the cautery treatment of lung disease and coughing.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When all coughs and illness of the lung are from moist humors, and the patient has no fever nor phlegm, and it is an ancient illness, then cauterize them with two cauteries on the collarbone in the places depressed by lions and buoys; and with another cautery in the middle place of the chest between two nipples; and let the cauteries be shaped according to the preceding form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, the cautery for puncturing should be done with the cautery called "puncta", the form of which is shown in the puncturing of earache.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And if there are points within them, apply to those; and especially cure that with water, as it is said before, so that it may be healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And if the cauteries are to have three branches, for cautery there are three cauteries which you can make according to this form:
Capitol .xxv.	"Chapter 25."
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	"The cautery of hemorrhoids that are at the end of the anus."
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	"When the head of the hemorrhoid is displaced due to slippery moistness and is not held in place during its return, you must reduce this displacement before it returns to its usual position, using a slight movement. This should be done so that it enters properly, as we have testified. At first, you should reduce the displacement while the patient is lying on their back or side. Then elevate the anal canal, which is inside the anus, with your left hand."
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And thus there are two heads to the cautery; this is its form:"
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	"And thus cauterize the anal canal so that it enters one inside the other. And now comes the figure of cauterization with four heads."
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"and this subtle according to the quantity of tentacle; and this is its form:"
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	"And sometimes it is adjusted according to this count, and therefore there are eight heads."
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat.	"And then pause on the cautery for five days with salt water, and then make sure that the patient rests quietly, and the member is not moved for any time until it is comforted."
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas desus e tart es fayt aquo, lahoras cauteriza sobre le muscle am cauteri clavilh o am motz cauteris puntan, quar la junctura es confermada e la humiditat es romauguda e le malaute es sanat.	"And if the displacement is towards the upper parts and it is done thus, then cauterize on the muscle with a clawed cautery or pointed cauteries, for the junction is strengthened and the moisture is removed and the ailment is healed."
Capitol .xxvi.	"Chapter XXVI."
De cauterizacio del stomac.	"On cauterization of the stomach."
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	"When there comes into the stomach much moisture and heat which causes it to become swollen and multiplicative in its nature, and if you continue with the usual methods of treatment and do not relieve it, then it is necessary for the ailment to be on its two sides, and extend its hands and feet, and then cauterize it with three cauteries: one on the left side near the pit of the stomach with a clawed cautery about the size of a finger, and two on either side of the ribs of the chest, so that the figure of the cautery is triangular; and extend those that are not suitable in order to avoid injury."
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	"And if the depth of the cautery is equal to the thickness of two thirds of the canal."
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	"And let the figure of the cautery be according to this form without addition. And if you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; and this is one cautery according to the form of a circle thus:"
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat.	"And the stomach should be punctured according to that which is feared from this cautery: and thus you will feel on the stomach puncturing with a tentacle as much as you wish, and then cauterize it in those points with a cautery; and then treat it with the treatment that is previously mentioned until it is healed."
Capitol .xxvii.	"Chapter XXVII."
De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	"On cauterization of the fatty liver."
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home.	"When there is pain in the liver due to coldness or moisture or excess windiness so that its normal condition is departed from by superfluous exit, and if the ailment is cured with what we have said and yet does not improve, then it is necessary for the ailment to be raised up on its back, and feel with a tentacle three cauteries according to this form and quantity measure over the liver on the left side of the hypochondrium where the decubitus of man lies."
E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	"And let the space that is between each cautery be according to the thickness of a finger, and let the cauteries be according to the length of the right arm."
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	"And do not compress your hand with the cautery too much."
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses.	"And if the quantity of what is cauterized is equal to the thickness of the middle finger, and it should not be pressed too much; and if the ailment stands on its feet, and if it does not stand up, then let it be made to lie down, which has already extended its feet, and raise its arms."
E es aquesta la forma del cauteri:	"And this is the form of the cautery:"
E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	"And it may be possible for you to cauterize these cauteries with a knife-cautery if you have subtlety and prudence in the art."
E guarda te que trop no procesiscas en la cauterizacio, e sia adhurida la specitut de tota la codena per que sia adhurit tot le cors e pervengua entro als budels, quar la codena aqui es subtil; e sapias aquo.	"And be careful that you do not proceed too much in the cauterization, and let the middle finger be cauterized entirely so that all the body may be cauterized and enter into the veins, because here the middle finger is subtle. Know this."
Capitol .xxviii.	"Chapter XXVIII."
De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	"On perforation of an abscess of the liver with a cautery."
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	"When there is an eruption or abscess in the liver and you wish to know whether that abscess is in the flesh of the liver or in its tunic, then if it is in the flesh of the liver, the ailment will be grave and painful without sharpness."
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	"And if it is in the tunic of the liver, then the pain will be sharp and great, and often the physicians are weary of treating it."
Donc cove que·l malaute sia enversat sobre la sieua cervit; e aprop senha le loc de l’apostema am tenta; e aprop igneys le cauteri le quel es asemblat a rag, la forma del qual a precedit en l’autra pagina.	"Therefore let the ailment be turned towards its back, and then feel with a tentacle the location of the abscess; and then kindle the cautery which is similar to a rake, the form of which has been described on another page."
E cauteriza am aquel i cauteri entro que tota la codena sia comborida, entro que pervengua al ciphac, entro qu’en yesca sania.	"And cauterize with that cautery until all the flesh is burned away, until it reaches the diaphragm, until in ashes it heals."
E aprop cura aquel per curacio dels autres apostemas entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with the treatment of other abscesses until it is healed."
E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	"But this form of cautery should not be used except by one whose studies in the art of medicine have been prolonged, and who has experienced many ailments; but even that one, sometimes, may be burned with this operation. But leave it to those who are better than us, for it is better."
Capitol .xxix.	"Chapter XXIX."
De cauterizacio de plauresi.	"On cauterizing pleasure."
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	"The ancients cauterized pleasure in this manner: first take from the vessels of the seminal ducts a dry vessel with a long opening that is found there, and its thickness should be like that of a finger."
E aprop submergeys aquela en oli e eysen aquela al foc, e aprop cauteriza per un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre la continuacio de la furcula am le col; e am dos cauteris petitz dejos guidazi, un pauc declinans a la partida que es dejus la barba, e am dos cauteris en aquo que es declinant entre la quinta costa e la cizena, declinant un pauc a las partidas detras; e am autre cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz; et am autre sobre l’estomac, et am tres cauteris de las partidas detras; et am un cauteri en aquel loc le qual es entre las dos spallas, e am dos cauteris dels dos latz del pietz, dejos le cauteri le qual es entre doas spallas.	"And then submerge this in oil and place it in the fire, and cauterize with a cautery at the location that is between the continuation of the collarbone and the neck; and with two small cauteries leave them guided thus, one slightly inclining towards the side that is below the beard, and with two cauteries on what declines between the fifth rib and the armpit, declining slightly towards the back sides; and with another cautery in the middle of the chest; and with another on the stomach, and with three cauteries on the back parts; and with one cautery at that location which is between the two shoulder blades, and with two cauteries on both sides of the chest."
E no cove que compremas la tua ma am le cauteri, ans sia en le manifest de la codena en obra.	"And you do not need to buy a cautery, but it should be in your chain in deeds."
E ja diyssero alscus antics que so alscus dels homes les quals uson de cauteri de ferr semblant a ray e igneysso aquel, e meto aquel en aquel loc le qual es entre las costas, entro que pervenguam am aquel ad aquel apostema e sia foragetada sania, ayssi cum havem dit en l’apostema del fietge.	"And those ancient people said that among men were some who used cauteries of iron similar to a ray and fiery like this one, and they placed it at that location between the ribs, until they reached that boil with it and it was opened cleanly, as we have said about the boil on the liver."
Mays en aquesta perforacio am cauteri no es ses temor, quar hu mor tantost ho accideys en le loc fistula a la qual no es sanacio.	"But in this perforation with cautery there is no fear, for many die instantly if it happens in the location of the fistula which does not heal."
Capitol .xxx.	"Chapter XXX."
De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	"Of the cauterization of the spleen."
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	"When you treat the illness of the spleen with what we have said about the cure in the division and do not agree with your treatment, then cauterize it in three ways, all of which are correct. One way is to make three or four cauteries along the length of the spleen according to its figure, similar to those of the liver whose figure has preceded."
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	"And between each cautery let it be the thickness of a finger or a little more, and the manner of the cautery should be as we have said in the cautery of the liver equally."
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	"And do not buy your own cautery, and let the disease be even on its two sides."
E es autra manieyra de cauterizar, so es que tu igniscas le cauteri haventz dos vertimentz, la qual causa havem dita en le capitol de dislocacio del muscle, e elava la codena la qual es en le endreyt de la melsa la hon perve le jazer del malaute sinistre.	"And another manner of cauterizing is this: ignite the cautery having two vents, whose cause we have mentioned in the chapter on dislocation of the muscle, and lift up the chain which is towards the spleen where the seat of the disease lies."
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	"And let your lifting be such that you lift up the chain along the length of the body so that cauteries are made according to its width."
E aprop entromet les dos vernimentz, ignitz mot, en aquel entro que am aquels penetres la codena de la autra part.	"And then introduce the two vents, kindle it immediately, into that place where with those you penetrate the chain from the other side."
E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	"And then extract the cautery; and thus four cauteries are made."
E si voys, cauteriza am cauteri havent tres vernimentz.	"And if you wish, cauterize with a cautery having three vents."
E aprop tu cura le cauteri pus que aia laysat de getar brac per trops jorns, quar mays es comferent que las autras causas precedentz en la curacio.	"And then cure the cautery, since it has left to give birth after too many days, for it is more beneficial than the other causes mentioned in the cure."
Capitol .xxxi.	"Chapter XXXI."
De cauterizacio de ydropici.	"On cauterizing a dropsical patient."
Cauteri no catz en ydropici sino en alcinte3 propriament.	"No cautery should be applied to dropsical patients except in certain cases."
Quan tu curas le ydropic am las manieyras de curacio las quals havem ditas en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que aquel cauterizes am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic e am un cauteri sobre l’estomac, e am autre cauteri sobre le fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa, e am dos cauteris entre les spondils del dos, e un cauteri en lo dreyt del pietz, e am autre cauteri sobre l’estomac.	"When you treat the dropsical patient according to the methods of treatment mentioned in this section and yet your treatment does not succeed, it is then necessary to cauterize him with four cauteries around the navel, one on the stomach, one on the liver, one on the spleen, two between the vertebrae of the back, one on the right side of the foot, and another on the stomach."
E la quantitat de la profunditat del cauteri sia propdana a la spicitut de la codena.	"And the quantity of the depth of the cautery should be proportional to the thickness of the skin."
E aprop layssa le cauteri ubert per so que gete brac per lonc temps.	"And remove the cautery promptly so that it does not burn for too long."
E no evacuas le malaute de curacio aprop le cauteri am aquo que cove per que sian agreguadas a lu doas entencios, e sira festinada a lu am ajutori sanacio.	"Don't evacuate the disease by cautery alone, but use whatever else is appropriate to add to it, and hasten recovery with helpful remedies."
La forma del cauteri am lo qual es cauterizat lo ventre sia clavilh segon que la forma de aquel es desus precedent, e es aquel am le qual es cauterizat le dos sia olivar segon qu’es precedent a la sua forma.	"The form of the cautery with which the abdomen is cauterized should be like a sword according to its previous shape. And that with which the back is cauterized should be olive-shaped, as it is previously described in its form."
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32
De cauterizacio de pes e de las coyssas.	Of cauterization of feet and legs.
Quan les pes so apostematz en ydropitz e so repletz de aygua sitrina, cove que cauterisas les pes sobre le dos del pe in nocrati aquo que es entre le auricular e le anular, e eleva la tua ma am le cauteri e no torses aquel; e aprop eleva la tua ma, e no retornes aquela de tot, quar l’aygua satrina rezuda.	When the feet are swollen in dropsy and filled with yellowish water, it is necessary to cauterize them on the instep of the foot between the little toe and the ring toe, raising your hand with the cautery and not twisting it; and then raise your hand and do not return that completely, for the yellow water will subside.
Es le cauteri segon aquesta forma: E aprop fay sobre las doas coyssas dos cauteris, e en quascuna coysa sia feyt cauteri am la extremitat del cauteri cutellar.	The cautery is made in this way: First place two cauteries on the two thighs and make a cautery on each thigh with the point of the cautery spoon.
E sia le cauteri segon la longitut de la coyssa: i dejos le denolh e l’autre jos le mieg loc de la coyssa; e sobre quascuna coyssa dos cauteris.	The cautery should be made along the length of the thigh, one below the kneecap and the other below the middle of the thigh. Two cauteries on each thigh are to be applied.
E layssa la plagua uberta ses curacio per lonc temps per so que alcuna aygua resuda de lu.	Leave the wound uncovered after its cure for a long time, so that no water may accumulate there.
E aprop cura le am aquelas causas las quals havem ditas.	And then treat those causes which we have mentioned.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33
De cauterizacio de cos de ventre.	On cauterizing the body of the abdomen.
Quan cos de ventre es per freg e per humiditat entro que debelice las vertutz, so es la vertut digestiva e retentiva, las quals so en l’estomac e en les budels, e es curat aquo am las manieyras de curacio e no confereys, e vezes le malaute suffertan cauteri de vertut exhiberant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am gran cauteri sobre le sieu stomac segon que a precedit en la cauterizacio del estomac, am le cauteri del cercle e am quatre cauteris en le cercuit del embelic subtils, am cauteri clavilh subtil; e am cauteri sobre le alcatin sobre alozis gran, o am dos cauteris.	"When the body becomes cold and moist internally, causing weakness in the organs, this is the digestive and retentive virtue residing in the stomach and intestines. This is cured by medical practices without cauterization unless the patient exhibits extreme symptoms, in which case a large cautery should be applied to their stomach as previously mentioned."
E si vezes las humiditatz exhuberants e le malaute aquo tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le pentenilh e sobre les budels, e fort leu ajustant dos cauteris sobre l’estomac e prop dels inguonas, quar es curacio perficent de juvament de la qual no erras.	"If there are excessive humidities and the patient tolerates it, then cauterize above the penis and intestines. Also apply two cauteries firmly to the stomach near the groin as this is a perfect cure for the ailment, in which you should not err."
Capitol .xxxiv.	"Chapter XXXIV"
De cauterizacio de emorroydas antiquas.	Burning of old hemorrhoids.
Quan so en la natura derier emorroydas antiquas o una de humors grossas fregas o de humiditatz corrompudas, e son curadas am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no confereys la tieua curacio, lahoras cauterisa am tres cauteris sobre le pus dejos spondilh del dos petit e petit triangular, e am cauteri desus le ombelic cays per dos ditz.	When there are recent hemorrhoids or one of the thick humors that rubs or corrupt humidities is present, and they do not heal with what was said in the division nor follow their usual treatment, then cauterize them with three cauteries on both sides of the anus near the bottom of the two small triangular folds, and with a cautery above the navel towards the two sides.
E si doptas que l’estomac de lu sia enfregidat e la vianda de lu no sia degerida, e la cara de lu vezes apostemada, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre l’estomac am gran cauteri segon que es precedit; e am un cauteri sobre fietge, e am autre cauteri sobre la melsa de lu am cauteri clavilh, e leyssa le cauteri per alcun temps ubert, e aprop cura lu entro que sia sanat.	And if you find that the stomach is cold and the food is not digested, and the face often appears pale, then cauterize it on the stomach with a large cautery as described above; and with one cautery on the liver, and another cautery on the spleen with a pointed cautery, leaving the cautery in place for some time until the wound heals internally.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter XXXV
De cauterizacio de atheyl aprop la abscizio de lor.	Regarding cauterization after the excision of hemorrhoids.
Quan tu abscindes atheyl, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri que es asemblat a ray.	When you sever a vein, then ignite the cautery that resembles an arrow.
Aprop entremet aquel ignit en aquel atheyl abscis, e ultima la tieua ma entro que pervengua le cauteri al orifici de la vena de la qual ve la sanc.	Apply the heated cautery between the severed vein and seal its opening until blood flow stops.
E fay aquo una vetz o doas, quar si achieyl son trops, lahoras cauteriza quascun de lor segon que havem recontat, e aprop cura aquels am aquo que confereys a lor dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And do this once or twice, because if there are too many veins, then cauterize each one separately according to what has been reported, and afterwards dress the wounds until they heal.
E si cauterizas am gran cauteri sobre alquatin, es mays derier en juvament.	But be careful not to burn too much skin with a large cautery, as it will cause greater harm than good.
Capitol .xxxvi.	Chapter XXXVI
De cauterizacio de fistolas que son faytas en la natura derie en las partidas de lu.	Regarding the cauterization of fistulas naturally occurring in the skin.
Quan la natura no obeziys a la obra la qual havem recomtada en son loc, e·l pacient es espaventat per aquo, sia sanat am cauteri.	If nature does not follow the treatment recommended here and the patient becomes frightened as a result, then apply a cautery to heal it.
Donc quan ad alcun ve fistola en la natura derier, e es antiquada, corro sania de lu e humiditatz corrompudas, e donc aquo que es pus digne que cove es que proes aquela am tenta subtil, e aprop conoys la quantitat de la profunditat de lu am la devant dita tenta.	Therefore, when there is some fistula appearing naturally on the skin that has become old and corrupted by dryness and moisture, then it is more appropriate to probe it with a thin, subtle thread and thus determine its depth using the aforementioned thread.
Aprop igneys le cauteri que es semblant a ray.	Then heat the cautery which resembles a ray.
E aprop met aquel cauteri ignit en aquesta fistula, e segon la quantitat en la qual intrec la tenta.	Then insert that heated cautery into this fistula, following the depth indicated by the thread.
E itera sobre aquela le cauteri entro que sian comburitz aquels cors corrumputz tost una veguada o dos o tres, segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And continue applying the cautery until those corrupt tissues are completely burned away in one or two or three applications, depending on the severity of the condition.
E guarda te de combustio de nervi e de vena; o si fistula va al cors de la vesica o al cors del budel, lahoras guarda te de totz aquels locz; e no fassas aquo sino quan la fistula es en loc carnos e cogitas que no es penetrant.	But be careful not to burn any nerves or veins. And if the fistula goes into the bladder or the intestines, then be very careful in those areas. Do not do this unless the fistula is in fatty tissue and you believe it is not penetrating deeply.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the wound until it heals.
E si le loc es sigillat, e so abscindidas de lu las materias, e roman ayssi per lonc temps, lahoras sapias que ja es curat entierament.	And if the opening becomes sealed and the infected material is removed from it, and it remains like this for a long time, then you will know that it has healed completely.
E si las materias no so de lu ostadas, lahoras sapias que es penetrant o en le preon de lu os corromput, o cays aquo de aquelas causas de las quals vindra rememoracio en son loc.	And if the infected material is not coming out of it, then you should know that it is penetrating or that there is some underlying bone corruption. This may be due to one of those causes which will be remembered later in this chapter.
Capitol .xxxvii.	Chapter XXXVII
De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of the cauterization of warts.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	"When pain is caused by rubbing or thick windiness in the lungs, and the patient's heart is thereby weakened, it is necessary to cauterize that area over the ribs with a pointed cautery on each rib."
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	"And then cauterize again, leaving a little space between them so that three cauteries can fit lined up, and finally place two more diagonally for reinforcement."
Capitol .xxxviii.	"Chapter XXXVI."
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Burning of the bladder
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there is debilitation and softening in the bladder due to friction and humidity, such that the patient cannot retain urine, then cauterize it at the opening of the urethra, where the hairs of the pubic region begin. Cauterize with a hot iron on the right side and another on the left side.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the amount of hair at the opening of the vulva. And cauterize there with a hot iron on the lower part of the vulva or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And use a cautery that is pointed, depending on what is being treated
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXIX
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of cauterizing the uvula
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When the uvula becomes dry and humid, and because of this conception is prohibited, and her menstruation is corrupted, and their onset is delayed, and there is pain during their emission, then that place should be cauterized with three cauteries in the region of the navel, as we have said for the cautery of the bladder; and with a cautery on the lower part of the vulva or with two cauteries, using a pointed cautery.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	"Regarding cauterization of dislocation of the ankle."
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	"When moist mucous exudes at the site of the ankle, and there are several causes of the swelling of its cavity, a sign of this is that one thing is prolonged over the other when they are compared between them."
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	"And the site of dislocation is found in the lower abdomen."
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	"Then you should cauterize the injury around the ankle with a circular cautery similar to this, for you will have marked around the circumference of the site as it is revolved, and thus the site will fall in the middle of the circle."
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	"And let the cautery be of such form as is used in the cauterization of the stomach."
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	"But if this cautery is not at hand, then cauterize with three cauteries having an olive-shaped point."
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And let the cautery be according to the amount of thickness of the whole cord; and afterwards care for it until it is healed."
Capitol .xli.	"Chapter XL1."
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	"Of Cauterization of the Sciatic Vein."
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	"When pain occurs in the site of the ankle due to friction and humidity, the injury is cured with that which we have said and not otherwise. But if it is ancient, then you should open the injury to remove thick humors with fetid pills or artificial pills or similar ones; and afterwards cauterize it."
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	"And the manner of cautery in that is according to two methods: either cautery with burning medicines, or cautery with fire."
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	"Knowing two methods, of which one is that you cauterize around the site of the ankle with three triangular cauteries according to this shape; and make them with good depth."
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	"And let the space between each cautery be equal to the thickness of the finger, and if the cauteries are olive-shaped or large."
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	"But sometimes it may be that the cauteries are placed over the middle of the top of the ankle, for there are four cauteries."
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	"And if you wish, cauterize with the circle which is prescribed in the form of cautery for dislocation of the ankle, so that it may be a continuous circle and burn through the thickness of the whole cord."
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	"And this is the manner of cautery in sciatica when pain is adhered to the ankle and not extended within the thigh."
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	"But if it is extended within the thigh, then cauterize there with two cauteries over the thigh at the location where you feel the pain that is the cause of it; and with one cautery over the shinbone about four fingers' breadth below the right side."
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	"And if the cautery is cuticular, let the depth of the cautery be according to the thickness of the cord."
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	"And if you find that the pain extends within the location near those said buttocks, then cauterize there where you feel it with cauteries of three points or four or more if necessary."
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	"And if you find that the pain is near the place where the thigh meets the buttock, then cauterize there with one cuticular cautery."
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	"And beware in all cautery that you do not finish the cautery to such an extent that you burn nerves or large arteries; and that because of this you do more harm than good or cause contraction."
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	"And I have seen some of those who cauterized over the shinbone and finished the cautery there, causing the leg to swell within so that the swelling reached the foot, and it was pierced and corrupted all the flesh."
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	"And moreover, accidental purging of the bowels often occurs, and because of this death."
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	"If pain is in two locations at once, then cauterize each according to this manner."
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	"And some wise men have said that in cautery of the ankle, this is the manner: make it similar to a circle of iron whose circumference is about a span; and let its depth be according to the thickness of a date bone or less than that."
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And within that circle let there be another third one; and let the space between them be equal to the width of a nut from the palm; and let those circles be open on two sides; and let their length be one or two nuts, and make their edge of iron neatly rounded in the circles; this is the form:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Approach fire to heat it until it reddens and sparks fly off, then place it on the part of the ankle, with the patient lying on their left side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And therefore cauterize that leg three times in one session.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then leave it to rest for three days; plaster that wound with the edge and let the bandage remain on too long; and cure that wound until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Oh, son, this kind of cauterization we have rarely used due to the fear of the wound's appearance, and because few patients we have found who tolerate it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	But among those who endured them, some had that mark on their leg.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	But cauterization with medicated irons is done by making two circles, one inside the other pierced with holes in which the hot iron door handle is placed; let the thickness of their walls be equal to the size of two nuts or those of similar size.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between them is equal to the quantity of the thickness of the finger, and they are opened below and above, and their length is such that they can contain themselves according to this shape:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then pause on the edge of the ulcer and place your hand over its opening; then take boiled water and pour it between the two circles, ensuring that the water has been heated gently over the fire for about an hour. Let the patient endure the burning sensation and discomfort until the burning stops.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand with the instrument and rinse off the boiled water from all around the ulcer with fresh water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Then leave it for three days and pause over it until the blackness of the burned area has disappeared. Then leave it for a few more days, and finally apply honey to promote healing. This is the last step in treatment.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	Then dress the wound with bandages until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain has spread to the foot or leg, do as follows: place a vessel containing water at the height of the ulcer, as was done with the water equalization.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the method for boiled water, which I have already written about in my treatise on the correction of medical terms.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Take equal parts of soda and unslaked lime, grind them together finely, and place in a new earthenware pot with a small hole pierced at the bottom, according to the size that fits inside the ulcer.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	Then place another earthenware pot upside down on top of it, and pour boiled water over the soda and unslaked lime mixture until it reaches about one finger's breadth. Then press it gently with your hand for good compression, and allow the boiled water to drain from the pierced hole into the inverted pot underneath.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	"Then carefully adjust all that water, and throw it onto another living creature or other renewed alkali, because at that moment it will be very caustic, which is administered in many medical operations and in cauterization of other members."
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	"And thus with some medicines with which wide areas are cauterized, such as tees (iron), melagrace and cause mixed with soap in this way that they are blended."
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	"And Gaul recounts an operation and cure with which sciatic vein pain is cured, and greatly praises it, saying that no other treatment is needed, because it is healed by one application as he recounts, for indeed the ointment in bath and plaster already knows about that."
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	"And it is that if possible take fresh centaury, and if not found, fig leaves may be taken; and much should be chopped with a little garlic and placed on the water where there is pain, or on the thing, or on the bed, and wrapped around."
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	"And it should be left for about three hours or until the patient feels relief from the adhesion."
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	"And then put him in a bath and when his body is warm, rub that plaster on it, because the pain stops and he is healed."
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	"And know that it is not necessary to use cautery with these medicines but only the evacuation of the body."
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	"As Hippocrates says, when the vein is narrowed by a goat's split, cauterize it and profit will come to its owner. The cautery should be prepared in this manner: wool should be taken and dipped in old oil, then placed between the toes of the foot and between the bones."
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	"And next, take a dry goat's hair and inflame it with fire until it becomes carbonized. Then place it on the wool and leave it there until it cools down."
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	"And continue to do this, not ceasing until the sensation of pain reaches the ankle and then rest the limb."
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	"And this method of cautery is called the 'cautery of vultures'."
Capitol .xlii.	"Chapter XLII."
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	"Of cauterization for pain in two places."
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	"Sometimes pain occurs in the back due to various causes, such as by contusion or blow or excessive evacuation, and for causes similar to these, by infusion of hot and humid matter."
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	"And cautery is not used except in this single case which occurs due to the effusion of hot matter."
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	"Therefore, first perform evacuation of the disease with pills made from drugs similar to those used for cautery, and place them on the back where the pain is located. The distance between each pill should be three lines according to its latitude, and for every ten pills or more, cauterize one line according to the amount of endurance of the disease and its strength."
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	"And perform cautery with cauteries having a pointed tip."
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	"And if you wish, cauterize with three or four cauteries using the middle cautery of the keyhole shape:"
Capitol .xliii.	"Chapter XLIII."
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	"Of cautery for the beginning of trembling (convulsions)."
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	"Very often this disease occurs in young children; the sign of its onset in children is that accidents occur on their spine with elevation and movement."
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	"And you will find inflammation in the last thoracic vertebra of the back and of the nerves that are already beginning to rise above the others."
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	"Therefore, when you see this and wish to prohibit it (i.e., prevent convulsions), immediately cauterize that area with a cautery that is circular in shape:"
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	"which should cover the entire width of the vertebra."
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	"And if you wish, cauterize around the vertebra with a pointed cautery two or three lines away."
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	"And let the points be close together between them."
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	"Then treat the wound that is healed with what we have said (i.e., dress it appropriately)."
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	"But be careful not to administer cautery in trembling caused by spasm of nerves."
Capitol .xliv.	"Chapter XLIV."
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	"Of cautery for gout and pain in the joints."
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	"When pain in the joints is caused by hot humors which are congealed in each member of the body, then when pains occur in the feet, it is customary for physicians to call this gout properly."
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	"And therefore, when gout caused by heat has been cured with treatment and the pains are not removed, then cauterize them."
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	"And if you cauterize that area for evacuation purposes, do so around the joint of the foot with many cauteries."
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And let the cautery be olive-shaped, of which this is the shape:"
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	"If it is necessary that points should be made on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery."
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	"And if the pains penetrate into the joints or other joints and this happens very often, then cauterize that area over each painful spot with three or four cauteries of the olive-shaped cautery throughout its entire width."
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	"And if many cauteries are necessary for you, then cauterize and do not press the cautery too hard beforehand, but only around the circumference of the joint."
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	"And if the pains penetrate into the joint and the bone, then administer the cautery that we have mentioned in its chapter."
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	"And if the pains are only in the muscles and it is called sciatica, then make punctures around the buttocks thus, making them two lines apart."
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	"And if the pains remain in these areas, then make punctures around the buttocks over each nerve and over the palm of the hand."
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	"And if the pains approach the hips to the loins or muscles, then cauterize each one throughout its entire length."
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	"And do not evacuate the illness through proper diet and receiving of medications, because if there is good regulation and inflammation is evacuated with this cautery without being healed, God help us."
Capitol .xlv.	"Chapter XLV."
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	"Of cautery for fractures."
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	"When a fracture occurs in the bones of the thigh or shinbone before reaching the knee, and this is how it begins, then you should order the patient to leave off eating on that day and to use gentle ointments so that the wound may heal from his belly."
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	"And then keep the patient between your hands over his bone, and command him to hold his breath so that his belly may be full or appear the knee or shinbone."
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	"And then return that area with your hands and press it with tentatively the fracture over the bone of the thigh with the signal of the extremity which is similar to the half of a circle in its upper parts of the body."
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	"And then ignite the cautery, of which this is the shape:"
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	"until it becomes very hot and emits sparks."
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	"And then reduce the shinbone or knee into its concavity, and then place your hand over that area so that the bone does not move."
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	"And you have now inserted between the patient's legs and left one of your hands resting on his leg, with another assistant serving under his buttocks, another under his thigh, which should hold his thighs."
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	"And then place the cautery on that signal with your hand and apply it correctly, and maintain it until you achieve contact with the bone of the thigh in the middle of the joint; and repeat this again if you have not achieved it on the first attempt."
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	"And carefully observe the sensation of the bone during your cautery so that you do not burn the bone and cause great harm to the patient."
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	"And know that if with the cautery you do not touch the bone, your operation is of no use."
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	"And the cautery for children should be subtle according to their size and measure."
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	"And then treat that area with bandages for three days until the burn scar is healed."
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat it with other remedies until it is healed."
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	"And the patient should lie on his back for forty days until the area and wound are completely healed."
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	"And it is necessary that you regulate the patient's diet according to the length of time for his cure which will empty his belly, and that the bone does not come out due to the effort of healing."
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	"And when he wants to get up after forty days, then administer a suitable plaster and keep him for another forty days."
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	"And let him be spared from work and from eating and drinking in abundance and from violent coughing, because when he uses this complete regimen of healing he will not be healed."
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	"And I will tell you the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the belly, and if they are large at the beginning, then cauterize the rupture with a round cautery according to its quantity, as much as it is protruded from the anus like the third section of it; and then treat it with what has been said, and nothing else."
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	"And some earlier authors have said that rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery like this figure:"
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	"And the line is placed that they pass through the width in the side up from under the rupture, and another line above; then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery should be lighter and better."
Capitol .xlvi.	"The forty-sixth chapter"
De cauterizacio de torcio.	"Of cauterization of the groin."
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	"When pain occurs in the upper limbs due to chafing or percussion and persists for a long time without improving with treatment using medications, it is then necessary to cauterize with a pointed cautery."
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	"And the cautery should be of such size according to the magnitude and smallness of the member, and its virtue and power, and the location of the hernia and the pain."
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	"So if it is healed by the first cautery, that's good; but if not, then apply the cautery again; for those pains are usually caused by pressure on a member near the one in question, so it is necessary to reach those with cautery until the illness is healed."
Capitol .xlvii.	"The forty-seventh chapter"
De cauterizacio de lepra.	"Of cauterization of leprosy."
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	"Some lepers have been viewed as cauterized with little benefit and even harm if the type of leprosy is caused by decay of phlegm and melancholy."
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	"And therefore, when you want to cauterize that person, consider whether the leprosy is contagious and whether it has been cured with what we have said in the division above. If not, then be afraid that the corruption will spread throughout his entire body and complexion. Therefore, cauterize him on the head with five cauteries: one in the middle of the head, another towards the end of the forehead near the hair; two on both horns; and one behind, on the nape or top of the neck."
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	"Finally, press your hand with the cautery a little deeper until it impresses slightly on the bone, and remove the scabs that have formed there, so that the expiration of thick vapors may be alleviated from him; and cauterize on the chest as is necessary."
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	"And if the leprosy has already spread over the person and appears manifestly, then you must cauterize that person with those cauteries which we have mentioned for the head; and cauterize on the tip of the nose, and with two cauteries on both cheeks, and with two cauteries on both shoulder blades, and with six cauteries on the spine of the back, and with one large cautery on the spine near the buttocks, and one on the buttock itself, and with two on the ankles, and one on each ankle, and with two on the knees and one on each knee, and with two on the elbows and two on the muscles of the calves; and cauterize him on all the joints of the said limbs and feet, and on each heel of his feet, and on the hollows of his hands."
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	"And beware not to burn those nerves which are situated on the heel lest you should injure them."
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	"Sometimes it is necessary to cauterize with one cautery on the bone of the sternum and another on the mouth of the stomach and another on the liver."
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	"And know that the more closely you apply the cauteries, the greater is the benefit and efficacy; and know that the person does not feel pain from the cautery as he would from his own sores, because his body has become numb."
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	"And it is necessary that the cauteries be large or small according to the limbs and joints as is prescribed by the nature of the instruments."
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And afterwards, dress the wound with fine bran flour mixed with honey and with another dressing until it heals."
Capitol .xlviii.	"Chapter XLVIII"
De cauterizacio de stupor.	"Of cautery for swelling."
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	"If any limb is paralyzed or numb and is treated with medications, oils, and plasters, but does not heal, then cauterize that paralyzed limb with a cautery according to the size of the limb or its smallness."
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	"And insert your cautery into the spine through an incision."
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for him until he is healed.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	Sometimes, certain wounds are cauterized which affect the hands and feet, the spine of the back and waist, and the nerves that move those limbs. The wound is then healed.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Only let those presume to do this who are wise in anatomy of the members and in the exit of nerves that move all the body.
Capitol .xlix.	Capítulo XLIX
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	On cauterizing warts that have been removed.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When the ulcer is ancient and does not respond to some medical remedies, then cauterize it with a pointed cautery according to the quantity of the specificity of the cord, until its whiteness and color are removed, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And appropriate for this is to cure it with flour of barley and lentils mixed with olive oil and leaves of sage, and with dove's blood or hen's blood, giving each one a portion and mixing all together, and then placing it on a cloth on the affected area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter One
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cautery of a boil.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a boil begins and you wish to open it, then cauterize around its circumference with a circular cautery in the circuit of it thus as it turns.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the wise say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of it; but I have not seen this, because I fear that it may become ulcerated, and I have seen it happen sometimes.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more correct to cauterize around its circumference with a circular cautery as we have said above, or with several cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter Two:
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	"Regarding the cautery of whitened skin."
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	"If some skin whitening is delayed in maturation, this may be due to superfluity produced by that (area), or because of the condition of the patient, who is elderly and decrepit with little blood, or because of time, and you wish to expedite the maturation of whitening; therefore cauterize around it with a small pointed cautery iron; and leave that (area) until it has matured."
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	"But if you wish to perforate with the cautery, then heat the cautery of which this is the shape: and place it in the middle of the whitening where the chain penetrates."
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if you cauterize that (area) which is lower down, so that the flesh of the arm may be alleviated, and then treat it until it has healed."
Capitol .lii.	"Chapter LII."
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	"On the cautery of ulcers."
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	"Ulcers are corrupting wanderings in the member, which consume that as dry wood consumes fire."
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	"Therefore if you cauterize that ulcer where it can withstand fire cautery, then heat cautery needles few and large according to what is suitable in that place where the ulcer is."
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	"And then cauterize it from beginning to end until you have completely eradicated all corruption and there remains no cause of it."
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	"And then leave it for three days, and bathe the cauterized areas solely with olive oil mixed (with honey) until all scars are eradicated and all corruption."
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	"And then treat it with fresh flesh-generating ointment."
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	"But if after three days you find that the flesh does not grow healthy where there is no corruption, then heat the cautery again on what remains in the corrupted places."
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	"And ulcers are sometimes treated with sharp medicine, because that is a halfway measure instead of cautery."
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	"But truly cautery with fire is the easiest remedy."
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	"And I have already spoken of the treatment of ulcers with sharp medicine in their division, and therefore take that when you begin to encounter them."
Capitol .liii.	"Chapter LIII."
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	"On the cautery of chilblains and similar conditions."
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	"Very often in the lower parts of the leg there appears a disease called chilblain, which is caused by cold and dampness, making the flesh numb. And it is treated in two ways: cautery with fire and cautery with hot water."
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	"But cautery with fire is done by heating the cautery concave similarly to a vulture's feather, which should be made of iron according to the quantity that the chilblain encompasses from beginning to end, and it should have thin edges."
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	"And then place that heated cautery upon the chilblain and then rotate your hand with the cautery around the circumference of the chilblain until it reaches the depth of it."
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	"Then leave it for three days until it begins to swell."
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	"And then apply a plaster of wild mallows pounded with salt, and leave the plaster on it overnight, because that will eradicate its roots."
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	"And then treat the place with flesh-generating ointment until it is healed."
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	"And if it is not healed, and many times this occurs on the surface of the body, more often in the thighs and legs, then you should administer cautery with hot water there. And that is done by taking a cannula of brass or iron or vulture's feather and placing it upon the chilblain; and then pour some hot water into the cannula and hold your hand, and rotate that with compression from above so that the edge of the cannula presses upon the root of the chilblain and the hot water flows to the front of the root of the chilblain. And wait for the pain of the hot water for about an hour, and then remove it, because the chilblain along with its roots will be eradicated."
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	"And do this to those likewise until all of them upon which they have appeared on the body are removed."
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	"And then treat those with ointments that cause flesh to regenerate since the roots of the chilblains have been eradicated."
Capitol .liiii.	"Chapter LIV."
De cauterizacio de tremor.	"On cautery for trembling."
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	"When trembling occurs due to chill in the nerves or fever caused by coldness, or some other similar cause, then you should cauterize it with four cauteries or five upon the vertebrae of the back, placing one cautery between each vertebra; and also cauterize its foot and over its stomach with an olive-sized cautery."
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	"And trembling will cease and the health of the cold disease will be restored."
Capitol .lv.	"Chapter LV."
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	"Regarding the cauterization of sudden accidents in the body."
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	"When the body is suddenly afflicted with sores and pustules from which matter issues that is thick and corrupt; therefore, it is necessary at the beginning to appear promptly and cauterize the head of the fistula with a thin cautery made of myrtle wood whose end has been heated in fire or with an elongated eraser or lenticular cautery."
