Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Boils are many species, of many kinds, according to their appearance, as they are mentioned in this book for each one.
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are diverse in their perforation and incision methods, of which there are two kinds: one for the specific type of boils; and for what is extracted from them by humectation.
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second method is according to the parts of the body where they occur, for a boil on the head is treated differently from one on the buttocks, and a boil on fatty tissue is different from one at a joint, and each has its own treatment method.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And moreover, there are some boils that should not be perforated but rather await their maturity or completion.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Some boils should be removed when they are hard and not allowed to reach maturity or completion, such as those near joints, for when a boil is near a joint its substance extends until it can burst, and often the ligaments or nerves of that joint are corrupted, causing contraction of that limb; or it is near a main limb, and if you delay perforating it until it is matured it may harm the main limb; or it is near the buttocks, then perforate it even if it is not yet matured; do not perforate one that is hard and incompletely digested, but rather one that is near the buttocks, so that you do not cause prolapse of its contents and elongation into the inner parts of the buttocks, resulting in a fistula.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	But know this: the time for perforating a boil is when it is matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	Know that a boil is matured when there is a decrease in pain and fever, and a reduction of redness and pulsation, and the head of the boil is sharp-pointed, and other signs.
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	And know that perforation should be made in the location where the boil is purest and where the purulent matter comes out from the opening of the boil.
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	Always perform perforation along the length of the flesh or skin if boils are located in the areas of the chest or belly, and in the location of ligaments, tendons, nerves, arteries, and in any other hidden locations where reflection is not possible; for those that are reflected upon, use perforation according to that limb.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	But when the boil is in fatty tissue, it is better to let perforation happen after digestion is completed according to what has been said; for if you perforate it before that time, the flesh of its opening will be prolonged and much putrid matter will come out, and often the lips of it are hardened and the depth of it is increased.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	But some boils are perforated across the width of the flesh or skin due to necessity, or according to what that limb requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	And you should perform a small perforation for smaller boils and a large, wide one for larger ones or many sections depending on the variety of sizes of the boils.
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And there are other boils in which the boil should be incised with curved forceps and cut when it has begun to appear, as happens with those that occur in mumps and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	"Of those that are situated in section having three angles; and of these is one in which it is inscribed thus like the figure of a mirror leaf, like the blisters of angles."
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	Of those where round section and crescent moon section are administered, similar to these.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one which is not like its superficial blisters of lions, you should pierce it with superficial or flat piercing alone.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And when the blister is large and has already collected much pus, you should pierce it and not worry about extracting all the matter at that hour; having extracted some of it, apply a poultice to the blister again the next day, and then extract a larger portion, doing this many times according to degrees until it is completely healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of a weak constitution, or pregnant woman, or young child, or elderly in decay, for the animal spirit many times is resolved with the exit of the pus, and quickly death may occur, so operate wisely.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Therefore guard this chapter with great caution, and especially the piercing that you perform on these blisters, taking care to cleanse the wounds and consider whether the wound of the blister is small or a flat section; then you should administer the remedies of lye or old cotton. And if the blister is large and the fissures of the piercing are many, then you should pause for some time until they heal together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the blister a portion of the skin is severed or concave at its circumference, then you should fill it with old cotton or thread made from linen cloth without moisture, just as when dressing wounds from cuts or scratches; strengthen that on the third day; and then proceed to treat it and heal it with whatever ointments are necessary until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if bleeding occurs during your operation, then you should administer water and vinegar mixed with linen cloth, pressing it on the location of the bleeding several times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then it is necessary to administer remedies and treatment and powders which are recommended in many places throughout this book and its divisions.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is wintertime and the location of the blister is a place with many nerves, then you should wrap powders in warm wine and oil and press them on those locations.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer and the locations are fleshy, then you should press powders soaked in water and oil or wine and oil, and all of this should be done frequently until the third day, as we have said. Then you should dress the blister and cleanse it and administer to its cure whatever is appropriate for it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary regarding the knowledge of the cure of blisters in general, but according to the way of distinction, I have already said how each type of blister should be cured individually, by chapters specifically.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XL.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the sectioning of blisters that occur on the neck.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	On the neck of the child, small blisters appear and these are of the species of knots that contain tunics which are produced from them; and there are many species of them.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And among them are pimples, and those contain moisture resembling lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	"These are those that contain moisture resembling dust, similar to them; and those that are like stones, hard."
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	"And in the section of all [organs], and in the extraction of these, there is no fear, because the extraction of those does not cause great harm."
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	"And the operation in section of these is that you spread them apart with an instrument whose shape appears like this, which is called 'entromes,' until you know what it contains."
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	"For if that which it contains is moisture, then cut it open lengthwise with a superficial section according to this shape:"
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	"And begin at the section of line B, ending at line G. Thus, when the moisture is evacuated, then you excoriate that which contains that moisture, leaving it without any cause whatsoever, because viewed troops return if there remains in it any cause."
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	"And immediately submerge it in Egyptian gum, if available, and if not, in water and salt; fill it with that and leave it there for another day, because with that you will corrode all that remains of that skin."
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	"And then iterate over that cut with Egyptian gum second and third times if necessary, until you are confident that there remains no cause of that skin; then cure the wound with gum until it is healed."
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	"If an abscess contains fatty nodules, then incise it according to this shape:"
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	"with a section having the form of a cross, and make an incision between both lips of the section and scrape it clean from all sides, and strive with all your strength to extract the tunic which contains that [abscess]."
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	"But if your arrow meets resistance, then do as I told you initially."
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	"And similarly do for the lapsed abscess in section and care according to what we have told you; and the incision on a lapsed abscess is easier, because it contains little blood and little moisture."
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	"And sometimes some of these abscesses are in the head of some men with whom there is no humidity at all; which is because you incise over an abscess on the head of an old woman and it appears like deaf stone, rough, white, which could not be punctured, and if someone were struck by that, they would be harmed."
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	"But in other accidental abscesses on the head, except this one, it is not thus, such as those that occur on the heads of children and at the roots of the ears; but the incision for these altogether should be a superficial incision."
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	"And pause the perforation of those with thin walls because it is lower down, so that the body may be relieved of the pain in the lower parts."
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	"And then cure them with what is appropriate for that particular cure."
Capitol .xlii.	"Chapter XLVII."
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	"On the incision of scrofulas that occur in the neck."
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	"Many times these abscesses occur on the neck, shoulders, and armpits; sometimes they also occur in other parts of the body."
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	"And those that occur on the neck are many and are often generated between them; and all scrofula of these is inside its own tunic, like in knots and abscesses of the head, as we have mentioned."
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	"And there are many types of these scrofulas, for among them some are stone-like, others contain moisture, and still others are malicious which do not yield to treatment."
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	"Therefore in that one which you find to have good disposition upon examination, of which the color of what is revealed is similar to the color of flesh, and it is movable on all sides, and it is not attached to any nerves of the neck, nor veins, nor artery, and it is not hard, then incise it with a superficial incision from above to below the body from line G to line B., and scrape it clean from all parts, and extend the lips of the flesh with an incision or several incisions if you have need of them, like we said for abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little."
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	"And it is more cautious that the vein or nerves not be incised."
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	"And let the spatula not be too sharp lest your hand slip during the incision and cause harm, or that you incise something which it is not necessary to incise; for if you should incise a vein or artery and hinder yourself from your operation, then pause with the powder of vitriol triturated or other powders which stop bleeding, and compress the wound, and let it rest until the sharpness of the abscess abates and the inflammation subsides and begins to heal."
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	"When blood is let out."
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	"So return to your operation once the blood has ceased."
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	"And then inquire with the little finger if there are any other causes of the other small scrofulas; therefore incise them and clean them."
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	"And if it is near a large vein, then do not incise the scrofula at its root."
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	"Then bind it with folded cloth tightly and let it remain until it falls off by itself without harm."
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	"And then fill the wound with old wax which you have already melted in Egyptian oil, and then dress it."
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	"If you incise that entire scrofula, then it is necessary for you to approximate the two lips of the wound and suture them immediately, so that there remains no surplus."
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	"But if you find that there remains surplus after the size of the scrofula, then it is necessary for you to extend the incision along its root and draw it out, and apply a suture and what is said."
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And those scrofulas that contain moisture, pierce them with a superficial incision here where it appears to you to be the point of maturation, and cease the incision from what is below the skin."
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	"And when administering an incision, be sure to cleanse it with ointment and bandages, so that what remains of the corruption is destroyed."
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	"And also when you see that the wound is already cleansed, then dress it with a healing ointment until it is healed."
Capitol .xliii.	"Chapter XLIII."
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	"Of the incision of the head of an accidental tumor inside the gullet."
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	"The ancients called this section 'the epiglottis,' and we have not seen anyone in our land who has performed it."
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	"And this is the inscription of their speech."
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	"But in men who suffer from quinsey, it is advisable to avoid the extraction of the epiglottis, because by doing so there would be damage to all the veins and major arteries of the throat."
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	"But in those who have tumors caused by cautery in the mouth or throat or ears, when the disease is not in the canal, it is advisable to perform an incision of the epiglottis to avoid the damage that can be caused by piercing."
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	"Therefore when we want to do this, we should incise the epiglottis on its left side with three circles of the epilothic circles or four with a small incision across its width in that which is between two circles in quantity, so that the incision is made in the cartilage and not in the cartilage itself. This location is convenient for an incision because it is devoid of flesh and its blood vessels are remote."
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	"And if the physician is fearful, then it is advisable to extend the thyroid cartilage of the throat with an awl, and afterwards cut through the cartilage until it reaches the canal, but avoid damaging any blood vessels if they are visible."
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	"And then incise the epiglottis according to what we have recommended, and it is indicated by the swelling that occurs there due to that which has come out from the disruption and by the absence of voice."
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	"Let the wound remain uncovered for a short time."
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the hour has come in which perforation is feared, apply two leaves of cabbage from the garden, and remove that alone which is the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then promptly administer medications to cause flesh to grow within so that it may be healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Al-Bukhāris said that the main point of this lecture is to explain that veins which some of these boils have already obstructed the windpipe of the patient, and the patient has come close to death, and their breath has been cut off, and some want to incise the epiglottis so that the patient may breathe over the boil for a little while, and thus save them from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And therefore command to leave the boil uncovered until the evil of the illness is consumed; and the evil of it lasts for three days; and then command thus to treat the boil, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And this is what I have seen with my own eyes: a servant took a knife and inserted it into his throat and incised a part of the pulmonary artery, and I was called to care for him, and I heard him moaning thus as the dead moan, and I uncovered the boil and drew out the blood which had issued from the boil little by little.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	And therefore I confess that he had not incised any vein or artery, and the wind issued from the boil, and I cured it until it was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And do not blame the servant if he did not speak in his voice, but returned to his usual manner some days later.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now you say that there is no fear in the section of the epiglottis.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Chapter XLIV: On incision for an abscess that occurs in the throat externally, which is called a throat hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess commonly called "throat hernia" is large according to the color of the body, and is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it occurs in two ways: either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	"And in nature it is not born to cure."
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	"And accidental heat comes in two ways: the first is like fat knots, and the second is like an aposteme which is made by the knotting of an artery; and there is fear in that."
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	"And iron should not be presumed to him unless it is requested."
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then you should examine that [the node], and if you find it similar to fat knots, and it is not suspended from any of the veins, then cut it like nodes, and extract it with this: " (The rest of the sentence is incomplete.)
Capitol .xlv.	"Chapter XLIV."
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	"Of the sectioning of types of knots."
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	"And there are many types of knots, all of which I have already mentioned in the division."
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	"However, you should also explain the difference between a node and an exitura when there is doubt."
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	"Therefore you say that in an exitura there is heat and fever and intense pain until the ebullition of the superfluity is suppressed; and it is complete putrefaction which then causes the fever, pain, and heat to cease."
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	"But in a node there is neither heat nor fever nor pain, and it contains only a small amount of fluid which is in its proper place."
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	"It is according to the color of the body, and its beginning appears like a boil and grows thus as an empty vessel, larger or smaller, and there are two kinds: either they are fatty and contain moisture, and the colors of this moisture vary, as I have said in the division."
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	"So then, when you come to the treatment of a boil, examine that person and ask him about its beginning with an instrument called 'intromes,' according to what the shape will be in the chapter which follows this one."
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	"And it is the method of inquiring about boils and all kinds of swellings, which is to take this instrument and insert it into the moist place that you find in the boil, turning your hands little by little until you know that the instrument has entered the channel."
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	"And finally, draw out your hand according to the measure of the size of the boil, and then remove the intromes and observe what has come out in its place."
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	"And if it is forgotten moisture that comes out, of whatever color it may be, then you shall cut it with a superficial section according to what I have said about other boils."
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	"But if there is no moisture from the trace of the intromes, then know that it is fat."
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	"And dry it with a section having the shape of a cross according to this form:"
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	"So that you may know how to do it, and suspend it with bandages, and tear out the channel from all parts easily, keeping the skin or sac, if possible, over it, and draw out that matter with the boil."
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	"But if it is broken during the operation and it is not possible to draw out that matter, many times you will find there, and then you shall draw it out bit by bit until nothing remains."
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	"For if something remains, little or much, the boil returns according to its usual manner."
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And if you see that some small part remains, then fill the wound with some sharp and strong caustic powders, cover it with a plaster for cauterizing boils, and treat it with the other treatment until it is healed."
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	"And if it is a large boil, then cut both lips of it and cure it with what you find there."
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	"But if the pulsatile vein appears on the contrary side, or non-pulsatile, then cover and dampen the place of cutting with threefold treacle that is vitriol and let it rest for two days or three until the wound clears up and the boiling of the blood calms down; and then return to cut what remains of the boil."

"And sometimes those instruments are made of others small ones resembling little forceps according to this form: with which blood is absorbed when it is done by flebotomy or in case of incising a vein or artery."
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	"And sometimes they are made round according to this form:"
Capitol .xlvii.	"Chapter .xlvii."
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	"Of the care of the nipples of men, which resemble those of women."
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	"Sometimes the nipples of some men become swollen during deep sleep when they begin to get hairy, and around them the nipples become swollen and resemble those of women with pimples."
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And to that which you see above, it is necessary to incise those with a crescent-shaped section according to this form, from line B to line G, and then scrape all the hardness, and then fill the wound with an ointment-containing dressing, and then join the two lips of the dressing with suturing, and cure it until it is healed."
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the nipple leans towards the sides and becomes softened by its size like those of women, then it should be cut in two on its own side with two crescent-shaped sections, each contained within the other at the end of each section, so that the larger line contains the smaller according to this form: from line B to line G. And then scrape the cord which is between the two lips of the dressing, remove the pus, and apply what we have said about suturing and powders as necessary in the cure until it is healed."
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if you do not fulfill the incision of that which needs to be incised because of the agitation of the illness and the flow of blood, then it is necessary to fill the dressing with cotton soaked in corrosive ointment and leave that until it has corroded what is rough, and then cure it until it is healed."
Capitol .xlviii.	"Chapter .xlviii."
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	"Of the perforation of boils that arise from the armpits."
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	"Those boils that arise from the armpits are of the kind called scrofulas, hard ones which contain a point that is to be extracted."
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	"And of those that contain moisture; and those that contain moisture should be incised with a crescent-shaped section according to this figure: from line G to line B. And when all that is in the boil has been evacuated, then fill it with cotton wool and leave it until the next day."
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	"And then the cotton should be removed and the boil cured with an appropriate ointment for that purpose, until it is healed."
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	"And if an abscess of the joints or scrofula is present, then incise it as we have said in the section on engorged scrofulas."
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	"If the inflammation has spread so that there is putrefaction, then apply cautery according to what we have said earlier."
Capitol .xlix.	"Chapter XLIX."
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	"Regarding the incision of abscesses that occur due to heat or phlegm."
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	"When the heat is broken and the cord that is on top of it becomes solid, then many times an abscess occurs. The signs by which inflammation and abscess are known to be due to artery or vein are: for when an abscess is caused by heat, it is long and adheres to the chest; and when you press the abscess with your fingers, you feel a harsh sound."
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	"And that which is due to a vein extends towards the belly of the body."
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	"And regarding this abscess, it is an error, especially in those that are situated near the axillae, around the joints, in the neck, and in many other places of the body; and if it is large, then its cauterization with iron should be avoided. And likewise, those that are on the extremities or on the head."
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	"Furthermore, regarding that which occurs due to inflammation of the tissues caused by heat, it should be incised along its length. Then, carefully open the incision with hooks and expose the artery, freeing it from its sheaths."
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	"And then place an needle on that side and insert it so that it pierces through to the other side. Then tie the artery with double thread in two places: this is useful for the extraction of two arteries which are located at the temples."
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	"And then pierce the spot that is between two ligatures with a spatula until all of the blood within it has been expelled, and thus the abscess will be resolved."
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	"And then apply a dressing that generates heat in order to keep the ligatures warm until they have fallen. And also dress it with appropriate remedies according to what is necessary until it is healed."
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	"And if it is an abscess due to the section of a vein, then you should hold with your hand what is possible of the abscess with the incision. Then insert the needle on that side which you have held with your hand and make it penetrate. Then tie the abscess with a double thread so that you can extract it from the other side, and then ligate the abscess with two threads according to what I have told you in the section on the grape of two parts with two extremities of the thread."
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	"But if you fear that the thread may break, then insert it with that needle along all of the abscess from its initial incision, and tie your threads in four places."
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	"And then dry the abscess in its middle part until it is completely drained. Then incise the excess of the incision, and leave what remains tied."
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And then place over it a poultice which you have moistened in wine and oil. Then apply the dressing that is made with dough and appropriate remedies until it is healed."
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1 of the abscess that occurs due to twisting of nerves
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess can occur in an artery or vein, similarly an abscess can also occur in nerves when they are struck or due to excessive exertion.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it most often occurs in the locations of the extensor muscles or the heel, or in any location where joints are strained.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious abscess, resembling the color of other flesh, and it has its greatest disposition without fever. When it becomes very tense, there is a sensation of numbness, as if in a state of stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that occurs on the chest, but rather outside of it, and it extends to all parts without reaching the front or back parts.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those that occur at the joints should not be covered with iron, for this would cause severe contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But one that is on the head or forehead can be opened with a scalpel.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then you should press it with your fingers and incise it with scissors.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you should suspend it with a hook, scrape it out, and remove it. Then adjust the flap with sutures, and dress it until it heals.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 2
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Regarding the incision of an abscess that occurs in the belly
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	There are certain men who have seen in the bellies of those and other parts of their bodies, tumors that are called funguals due to their similarity with fungi. Their root is subtle but their head is large. Sometimes their lips are turned inward, and they are either small or greatly magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one, and in his belly there were two tumors resembling fungi, with no difference between them, being small and white.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of these tumors were inverted and split open, and moisture flowed from them continuously.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I incised those tumors and removed one weighing eighteen ounces and the other six ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the procedure for their incision is this: first consider whether the illness is moist, and if the color of the tumor is white, moist, and has a subtle root. Then incise it with a broad scalpel, and have cauteries ready in the fire at hand, for many times much blood flows out during the section, and if blood comes out, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	But if the illness is pale and fearful, beware of incising with iron. Instead, take fresh lead wire and insert it into the tumor according to the manner we have described, and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	Then adjust at the constriction of the lead wire; continue to insert lead until the tumor is completely absorbed and falls off without being touched.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the tumor has a large root, then its incision can cause fear and trembling, especially one that is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible to incise most of it and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And dress it until the wound heals.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	But beware that you do not presume to incise a tumor that is of dark color, has little sensation, and is guarded well, for it is cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I remember this in connection with cancer.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 52
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Regarding the treatment of an umbilical hernia
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An umbilical hernia is caused by many things: either by fissures of the skin that is over the belly, or from the tissue or bowel protruding through other ruptures; or by blood flowing from a vein or artery, as has been mentioned before, or by constricted wind in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to a fissure of the skin and protrusion of tissue, then the color of the abscess will be similar to that of the flesh, with little pain. It will appear in various places.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	But if it is due to a prolapse of the bowel, then its location will be as we have described above, with great variation in position. When you press on it with your fingers, it disappears but soon returns. There is much noise and pain with it, and it becomes greatly enlarged during bathing or vigorous activity.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to moisture, then there will be little noise and it will not disappear when you press on it with your hand. It will neither be constricted nor enlarged.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	"When it's due to blood, then this abscess appears blackening."
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	"If it's due to flesh, then the abscess is severe, large and hard, and its amount varies."
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	"But if it's due to wind, then touching it feels like a lion."
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	"And the operation is to consider now if the prominence of the navel is due to arterial blood or veinous blood or wind, then you should be prohibited from treating it, because in this case there is fear and dread as I have taught you in the chapter where I spoke about apostemes by artery and vein."
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	"And if the prominence of the navel is due to the bowel or tissue, then you should command the patient to lie on their back and stay stretched out. Then, mark around the entire navel with your finger and then command them to turn onto their hands and knees but still over their two hands, and then surround the navel's area marked with a broad spatula. Then extend the mass of the abscess upwards using a large hot poultice, and finally bind it around firmly with a bandage or cloth in the appropriate manner."
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	"And then heat the middle of the extended abscess over the bowel and insert your finger into that spot to seek out the bowel. And if you find it and hold it with your fingers, then gently extract it and push it back inside the abdomen."
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	"And if you have found the tissue, then take a pair of forceps and cut out its excess."
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	"But if it is against your artery or vein, then surround that area and return to your operation. Then take two needles and insert them into those two strong threads and insert the two needles into the circuit you have made around the abscess in a cross-shaped manner, making sure they penetrate. And then stretch the abscess in four directions over the needles."
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"And if you wish, remove the needles and allow the location to close up naturally with the stretched skin falling back into place. Or cut it open when it has softened and become supple, and then dress it using whatever is appropriate for wounds until it heals."
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	"And if the prominence of the navel is due to fat or humidity, then you should incise the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or humidity that you find in it. Then dress it with whatever is appropriate and ensure that the location is consolidated."

De curacio de cranc.	Of the treatment of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	"We have said, in the division of the species of crab and in what manner it is to be treated with medicines, and that its cure is hindered by iron lest it should become ulcerated; and we have spoken of a crab generated in the greater and lesser care of the treatment of it."
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	"The ancients said that sometimes crab is found in places where its eradication is possible, such as on the breasts or between the thighs, and they advised excising all of it, especially when it is beginning small."
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	"But when it is advanced and deep-seated, do not approach it, for you will not be able to heal that ulcer nor have I seen another like it."
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	"And the operation in that case is as follows: you should first relieve the pain and purge black bile occasionally, and then apply a poultice if there is a manifest swelling present."
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	"And prepare the patient for the operation, and apply a poultice in that location with caution, and prohibit cutting wounds which are not necessary; and also hollow out all parts with the chain saw with good precision so that no cause of the roots of the ulcer remains."
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	"And let the blood flow freely, and do not remove it too lightly; express the locations and wipe off all of the thick blood with your hand or with an instrument which is at your disposal among the instruments."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if it causes you difficulty to remove thick blood from a vein or artery incision, then cauterize that place until the flow of blood has ceased, and then treat it with another treatment until it is healed."
Capitol .liv.	"Chapter 52."
De curacio de ydropici.	"Of the care of dropsical persons."
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	"We have already discussed, in the section on the classification of dropsies of water, and the signs of each type, the treatment of it with medications."

E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo. sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	"It should be long with two pointed ends, like a spatula, but nevertheless it should have some shortness little by little, so that in the operation you do not go inside the bowel and harm it."
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh. Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	"But if the generation of dropsy is due to disease of the liver, then your section should be on the left side of the navel by three fingers' breadth."
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	"And if the cause of it is from the spleen, then your section should be on its right side."
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	"And do not make your section over the side towards which you want to draw out the excess fluid, for fear that it might flow into that place."
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	"And immediately perforate with the instrument all the canal, and enter into that section, and raise your hand with the spatula between the canal and the siphon, and you shall draw out from it; if there is the quantity of a fingernail or even more."

e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	"And it resembles a thin silver cannula; it is made of silver or iron or latten lion, at its lowest part there is a small hole, and on its sides there are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and its extremity is cut in the manner of a feather, like this:"
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	"And at its uppermost extremity there is an armilla (a small hole), because when the instrument reaches the water, then that water will immediately descend upon the instrument, so that it evacuates water into the middle ear in moderate quantity; for if you evacuate more than necessary at that hour, it may cause sudden death due to the resolution of its animal spirit or approach the fifth stage near death."
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	"But evacuate it according to its quantity, considering the strength of the patient, the symptoms of the disease, the virtue of the pulse and his condition."
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	"And then remove the instrument and retain the water which is kept by the canal that retains the hole made on the siphon which you were advised to perforate in this manner."
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	"And repeat the operation on another day if the patient can tolerate it, and draw out a small quantity of water; do this for several days with caution, making sure that not much water remains."
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	"But if you draw out too much water from the patient, then cure him with embalmment in hot sand, and rub him with a lot of salt in his bath, and expose him to the sun for a long time; and treat him with drying medicines until he is healed."

De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	"Of the treatment of children who are born withimperforate openings for urine."

De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of the whitening of the foreskin on the glans penis, and of its roughness, blackness, and adherence to the glans penis.

"But if it happens on the foreskin of the head of the penis in an uncircumcised person, and one part of the inflammation is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you should remove the inflammation that is inside at the beginning until it is consolidated; afterwards, cure the outer one, because if you cure them together with the foreskin, it may become constricted."

quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	"because cautery is useful in two ways at once: it stops bleeding and prevents gangrene when it becomes corrupted."

Capitol .lvii.	"Chapter LXVII."
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	"Of the purification of children and the treatment of what happens to them during circumcision."
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	"Circumcision is not a cure for continuity like other diseases: but since it is within our operation and willpower, and its purpose is specifically for children, it is necessary that we assign the best operation and easiest way to achieve health."
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	"So they say that the ancients did not mention circumcision in any of their books, because they did not use it in their laws. "And I have already tested all these methods and did not find better purification with tweezers, liniment with chalk or purification with the nail, because many times it escapes the cord above, because the skin of the foreskin has two tunics, and the inner one remains, which is why another incision and safe pain are forced."

"But from the purification that is done with tweezers and liniment with chalk, I find it good through experience, because the tweezers are of proportional incision, because the sharpness that is above is as much as the sharpness that is below; therefore when you press your hand so proportionally with two sharpnesses, you cut according to a comparison in one time; and compression of chalk is made with a figure containing the skin of the whole foreskin, without any error."
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia. La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	"The form of the tweezers for purification is as follows:"

Capitol .lviii.	"Chapter LVIII."
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	"On the treatment of retained urine in the bladder."
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio. Capitol .lix.	Chapter LIX.

Capitol .lx.	Chapter LX
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the Extraction of a Bladder Stone
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already discussed in the division of species the types of stones and their treatment with medicines, and the difference between stones generated in the kidneys and those generated in the bladder, and their signs.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said that in some operations on stone, hand manipulation or incision is required.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which remains in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And thus we explain this with clear and concise exposition.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore it is said that stones generated in the bladder mostly affect children. And among its signs are that urine which exits from the bladder resembles water in its fineness and appears cloudy; the pain feels like a sting, and many times it prevents urination, and at other times it flows freely; and with that there is often straining of the anus.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it would be easier to cure children of this condition while they are still young, before they reach fourteen years of age; but it is difficult to treat in the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But among the young, it is midway between these two extremes.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that person in whom the stone is large and its removal will be easier; but if it is small, it is difficult to treat.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, when we approach the treatment of this condition, it is first necessary to alleviate the pain using a catheter that extracts all the sediment that lies in its channels. For sometimes these channels prevent the expulsion of the stone during its investigation.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then place the patient on his back and have him lie down quietly, lifting his hips with pillows so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder or near it.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then prepare the catheter that you have selected and place it near the things necessary for this procedure, so that the bladder may be entirely filled declining towards its sides.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then wait until it is full and empty it completely.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in its place, then promptly make an incision above it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not feel it with your touch, then apply olive oil to your index finger and insert it into the anus of the child or middle finger in that of a full-grown person.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And wait for the stone to lie near your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	Then gradually bring it towards the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	Then press on it with your finger and expel it through the sides outside where you have made the incision.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	Then command the assistant to press on the bladder with his hand; and command another assistant to extend the thighs upwards with his right hand, while with his left hand he presses down on the cord that lies beneath them near the place where the incision is being made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then introduce a spatula made according to this design:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	"Make the incision between the patient's buttocks and genitals, not in the middle, leaning towards the left side; let the cut be on that stone (kidney) and your hand be in the anus, and make a transverse cut, so that the outside of the cut is wide and inside is narrow according to the amount the stone can possibly allow, no more, for otherwise you will crush the testicle which is behind the stone where the cut should be made."
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	"You must know that some stones have an acute angle or margin, which makes their extraction difficult because of this."
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	"That stone is like a glans (penis head), round and easily extracted."
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	"Therefore if it has acute angles or margins, adjust it in the slit."
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	"And if it is not easily extracted, then you must press down upon it gently and decently with your finger whose tip should be like a chisel with which you press down on the stone, without sliding off of it; or else you may insert one of those thin curved instruments into it."
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	"But if you cannot press down upon it, then widen the incision a bit; and if you see blood flowing out, cauterize that with burnt vitriol."
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	"But if there are more than one stone, then at the beginning you should insert your hand into the mouth of the bladder and cut open upon it; and similarly push a little further onto it; and similarly proceed if there are many more stones."
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.
