"And if the childbirth has come, then make her sit upon a cushion, and study upon the reduction by hand, and scrape the child according to its natural figure, and make the woman sneeze and command her to press herself until it is forgotten."
Eyssiment del fet sobre·l col expandudas las suas mas e la fassia de lu es al dos de la sua mayre.	"Emergence of the child upon the nape of its neck with its shoulders spread out, and its face turned towards its mother's back."
Cove que la matrona tengua la ma del fet e aprop revolva aquel petit a petit, e eque aquel am facilitat.	"It is necessary for the midwife to have her hand on the child's head and also turn it little by little, and bring it out with ease."
E cum es e quant so es engualhat, e lahoras pausa sobre le conh de lu aquo que havem recomtat de oli e de mucellages.	"And when that is done and when it has been scraped, then place upon its head what we have described of oil and mucilages."
E aprop comandas a lu que·s maugua petit a petit, e quan auras feyt aquo, lahoras fay aquela cezer sobre una cezelha e comanda li que sia inclinada sobre le latz dreyt, e aprop comanda a lu que sia compremuda; e fay aquela stornudar am condizi.	"And then command her to rub it little by little, and when you have done that, then make her sit upon a cushion and command her to lean towards the right side, and also command her to press herself, and make her sneeze with incense."
Exitus foetus praeparati super latus.	"Emergence of the prepared fetus upon one side."
Quan deyssen a horrifici de la mayre segon aquesta manieyra, considera, e lahoras tu inscideys la segondina am la tua ungla entro que sia evacuada de la humiditat.	"When there is horrible emission from the mother according to this manner, consider it, and then make an incision with your nail into the second one until it is evacuated of moisture."
E si le fet es suspendut sobre la cara e·l col de lu, lahoras tu inscideys aquela del embelic, per so que no sia retengut e mora.	"And if the child is suspended upon its face and nape of the neck, then make an incision into the belly to prevent it from being retained and dying."
E aprop empelleys le fet a las partidas dedintz entro que pauses aquel segon que cove, e manda a la femna que comprema a si alcunas veguadas, e el sira fora-getat am eyssiment leugier, si Dieus o vol.	"And then push the child towards its parts inside until you place it according to what is necessary, and command the woman to press herself several times, and it will be forgotten with light emergence if God wills it."
Exitus geminorum aut foetuum multorum.	"Emergence of twins or multiple fetuses."
Sapias que gemels motas veguadas so natz, e alcunas vetz naysso tres o quatre , mays aquo es estranh e tart s’endeve; mays v so causas foro natura, e no vivo.	"Know that twins are often born, and sometimes three or four, but this is rare and strange, though it happens by nature's decree."
E conte aquelas, ja sia que sian montiplicatz, una segondina, e son seperatz per ciphac, distingen aquels enter le liguament en l’ombilic de cascun de aquels E alcunas veguadas so foro-getatz ayssi cum es un fet per eyssiment natural leugier, e so eysitz alcunas veguadas per eyssiment no-lausabla ayssi cum havem recomtat.	"And count those [ovaries], whether they be multiplied or not, and separate them by cyphac, distinguish each one within the ligament in the navel of each."
E si son dificils alcus de lor deves le enfantament e perveno ad aquo que havem dit de las figuras no-naturals, lahoras tu cura aquels ayssi cum havem recontat.	"And if some of them are difficult to remove at childbirth and arrive at what we have said about the unnatural shapes, then you take care of those as we have recounted."
E si’ la matrona subtil e fassa aquo que fa am facilitat e subtilitat, e am tarditat, e sia ingeniat segon tota figura segon que es a lu preparat de l’engen amenant a salut.	"And if the midwife is subtle and does what she does with ease and subtlety, and slowly, and has the skill according to all shapes as it was prepared by the ingenious [person] bringing about health."
Rememoratio eius quod formatur in matrice ex embrionibus et Abortiuntur.	"Remembrance of that which is formed in the womb from embryos and those which are aborted."
Alcunas veguadas son formatz en la mayre un, e dos, e tres, e quatre, e v, e vi, e vii, e mays x, e ja es deves mi verificat que una femna abortem ne getet vi, e una autra x totz formatz, la qual causa fo fayta per mensuracio dels glorios savis.	"Some are formed in the mother's womb one by one, two by two, three by three, four by four, five by five, six by six, seven by seven, and more than ten, and it has been verified that one woman aborted six, and another gave birth to all ten, fully formed, which is a cause noted by the glorious wise men through measurement."
E tot aysso cove que sia en la sciencia de la matrona quar fort leu ad aquela parve semblant de aquo, e donc opause se ad aquo am so que cove.	"And also, it belongs to the science of the midwife to know well that which is similar in this small creature, and therefore she should pause at that until she knows what it is."
Capitol .lxxvi.	"Chapter seventy-six."
De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	"About removing the fetus when it is dead."
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio.	When you treat a dead fetus according to what we have said in the section on medicine and it has not yet emerged, and you wish to use manual operation, then consider if the woman is of sound virtue and not among those with conditions which could lead to harm upon her.
Lahoras cove que la femna sia envessada sobre le lieyt sobre le sieu dos, e sia le cap de lu enclinat enjos e las coyssas de lu sian elevadas.	Then the woman should be placed on her left side on the bed, with her head lowered and her hips elevated.
E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the assistant should hold her from both sides or tie her to the bed so that her body does not extend during the extraction of the fetus.
E aprop tu humecta la boca de la mayre de lu am olis humitz e am mucellage de altea e de fenugrec e de semensa de li.	And then you moisten the mother's mouth with humid oil and a poultice made from marshmallow, fenugreek, and sesame seeds.
E aprop unte la matrona la sua ma am aquels olis e mucellages, e aprop entrometa la sua ma am fecilitat en la mayre, e aprop cerque am la ma loc en le qual fique les uncis en le fet.	And then the midwife anoints her hand with those oils and poultices, and gently inserts it into the mother's mouth, and seeks with her hand the place where the hooks will be inserted in the fetus.
E locs convenient en aquo: adonc tu considera si le fet es preparat que deysenda sobre le sieu cap, e lahoras tu fique les uncis en les huels de lu, o en le col, o en la boca, o en le palat, o dejos la barba, o en la furcula de lu, o en les locs propdas de las costas, o dejos les ypocondres.	And the appropriate places for this are: then consider if the fetus is prepared to be expelled from its head and position the hooks accordingly in one of these locations: its cheeks, its neck, its mouth, its palate, below its chin, at its beard, at its collarbone, near its ribs, or below its chest.
Mays si le deysendiment es sobre les pes de lu, lahoras en le pentenilh, o en le mieg de las costas.	But if the expulsion is happening from the feet of the fetus, then place the hooks on its heels or on the middle of its back.
E cove que tengua le unci am la ma dreyta, e pausa la curvitat de lu en aquel loc le qual es entre les ditz de la ma senestra, e entrometa la ma am facilitat e fique le unci en alcu de aquels locs les quals havem ditz, entro que pervengua a la causa boyda.	And hold the hook with your right hand and pause its curvature in that place between the fingers of your left hand. Then gently insert your hand into the appropriate location we mentioned earlier until you reach the cause of the obstruction.
E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament.	"And then place one or two additional pillows near them to support their back, ensuring they lie evenly and do not extend beyond their usual position."
Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	"And also heat should be applied to the entire area, so that the inflammation is relieved as it would be during the eradication of the tooth."
E cove en lu aquo que es entre lor que la extencio sia mollificada; e si alcuna partida de lu es retenguda, lahoras cove que la matrona unte alcus sieus ditz am oli e entrometa aquels espertament e revolva am aquels aquo que es retengut.	"And also ensure that the extension is softened with water; and if any part of it is retained, then the midwife should anoint some of her fingers with oil and carefully insert them and move them about with the water that is retained."
Donc si la partida del fet es fora-getada, lahoras les uncis sian permudatz entra loc le qual sia pus aut; e fay aysso entro que tot le fet sia fora-getat.	"Therefore if the childbirth is delayed, then let the hands be changed for another who can be more useful; and do this until the entire childbirth has been completed."
Mays si la ma es eyssida denant l’autra, e no es possible reduzir aquela per la coartacio de lu, lahoras cove que drap sia envolopat sobre aquela; e aprop extratz aquela entro que tota sia fora-getada, e inscideys aquela o en la junctura de la ma o en le coyde.	"But if the hand becomes stuck before the other one, and it is not possible to reduce that by pressing on it, then a cloth should be wrapped around that; and carefully pull that out until everything has been delivered, and incise either at the joint of the hand or in the elbow."
E ayssi cove que fassas en l’autra ma e en les dos pes.	"And likewise do this with the other hand and with both feet."
Mays si le cap del fet es gran, o accideys a lu coartacio en le eyssiment, o es en le cap de lu aygua ajustada, lahoras cove que entrometa entre les ditz espatum spinos e fenda le cap e extragua la aygua, o que discroba aquel am un instrument le qual es nompnat “alundat”, la forma del qual vindra am las formas dels autres instruments en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	"But if the head of the child is large or there is difficulty in its delivery due to contraction of the passage, or it is stuck at the entrance of the waters, then let the space between the aforementioned spinous processes be opened and cut the head and remove the water, or else use an instrument called "alundat" to perform this operation, the form of which will come with the forms of other instruments in the chapter that follows."
E semblantment fassa si·l fet es de gran cap per natura: e lahoras cove que inscida aquel am algematu, o que prengua aquel am alunda ayssi cum havem dit; e aprop extra les osses am les forceps.	"And similarly do this if the child has a large head by nature: and then it is necessary to incise with an instrument called "gemat", or use the aforementioned "alundat" in this way as we have said; and afterwards remove the bones with forceps."
E si le cap es eyssit e es coartat deves la furcula, lahoras sia fendut entro que la humiditat la qual es en le pietz sia efunduda.	"And if the head has exited but is constricted behind the pubic arch, then let it be cut until the humidity that is in the pelvis has flowed out."
Mays si no es complicat, ni obezeys a eyssiment, lahoras tu inscideys le cap tantost segon que a tu sira possible.	"But if there are no complications and the birth is not obstructed, then you should incise the head as soon as it is possible for you."
E si le dejos del ventre es apostemat o es en lu ydropici, lahoras cove que tu perfores aquel entro que corro la humiditat que es en lu.	"And if the left side of the belly is inflamed or in a state of dropsy, then it is necessary for you to pierce it until the humor that is inside it flows out."
Mays si le fet es sobre les sieus pes, lahoras la atraccio de lu es leugiera e la direccio de lu a la boca de la mayre es leugiera.	"But if the child is above its own feet, then its attraction will be light and its direction towards the mouth of the mother will be easy."
Mays si es coartat deves le ventre e·l pietz, lahoras cove que tu extraguas aquel am drap le qual auras envolopat sobre la tua ma, e que fendes le ventre e·l pietz entro que corra aquo que es en aquels.	"But if it is constricted behind the belly and the pelvis, then you should remove it with cloth that you will have wrapped around your hand, and cut the belly and pelvis until water flows from them."
Mays si les autres membres so ostatz e torna le cap, lahoras la metrona entrometa la ma senestra; mays si la boca de la mayre es huberta, lahoras intrometa la ma en le preon de layre, e cerque am aquela le cap, e atira aquel am les ditz entro a la boca de la mayre, e aprop entrometa en lu un unci, o dos uncis, e atire lu am aquels.	"But if the other members are obstetrical and the head returns, then let the metron enter with the left hand; but if the mother's mouth is covered, then let the hand enter into the perineum of the vulva, grasp the head with it, draw it with the aforementioned entrance to the mother's mouth, and afterwards insert one or two hooks and draw it with those."
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada per apostema caut le qual accideys a l’u, lahoras cove que no sia trebelhat sobre lu; abantz cove lahoras aministrar efusio de causas humidas grassas.	"And if the mother's mouth is obstructed by an ulcerative swelling that has occurred on her lip, then it should not be troubled with that; but at that time it is necessary to administer a purge of thick humid causes."
E aministre emplastres; e segua le pacient en ayguas que mollifican e humectan.	"And apply poultices; and follow the patient with waters that soften and moisturize."
E si le fet es sobre le sieu costat, lahoras si possible es, sia agulat: e sia aministrat aquo que havem dit en le fet viu.	"And if the child is lying on its side, then if it is possible, turn it; and administer what we have said for a live birth."
E si aquo no es possible, lahoras sia inscidit en pessas, e sia extrayt.	"But if that is not possible, then let it be incised in pieces, and let it be removed."
E cove que non layssas alcuna causa dedintz de la segondina.	"And you must not leave any cause inside the secondine."
E cum tu auras complida tota la tua opperacio, lahoras aministra aquo que havem dit de la curacio en les apostemas cautz les quals accideysso de la mayre.	"And when you have completed your entire operation, then administer what we have said about the cure of ulcerative swellings that occur in the mother."
E si accideys flux de sanc, lahoras deyssendas en ayguas stipticas e aministra l’autra curacio.	"And if there occurs a flow of blood, then let her drink waters that are styptic and administer the other cure."
E yeu ja e vist una femna en le ventre de la qual era fet mort, e aprop sobre aquel foc autra veguada emprenhada, e aprop foc mort es le fet autre.	"And I have seen a woman in whose belly there was a dead child, and again afterwards pregnant over that same focus, and again the child was dead."
Accidit al u aprop lonc temps apostema en le sieu embelic; e inflat es entro que foc ubert, e comensec a getar brac.	"It happened to him that for a long time an ulcerative swelling appeared on his abdomen; and it swelled until the focus was covered, and he began to have pain in his arm."
E yeu fu appelhat a la cura de lu, e medicat a lu per lonc temps, e la plagua no es consolidada.	"And I was called to cure him, and I treated him for a long time, but the plague did not consolidate."
Adonc yeu pausegui sobre lu de alscunas causas emplastra de forta atraccio, e eyssic de lu un os, e aprop passero alcus jorns, e eyssic un autre os; e yeu fu trop meravilhat, cum en le ventre no sia os.	"Then I applied over it poultices of strong attraction for some causes, and removed from him one bone, and after some days passed, I removed another bone. And I was very amazed, because there are no bones in the belly."
E adonc yeu cogitegui que eran dels osses del fet mort.	"And then I realized that they were the bones of the dead child."
Donc yeu enguisigui la plagua, e extrayssi de lu motz osses , la femna existent en las sieuas milhos disposicios, e ja visquec en tal manieyra per lonc temps, correc de lu un petit de brac.	"Therefore I cured the ulcerative swelling, removed from him many bones, the woman existed in good health, and already lived for a long time, running around without any pain in her arm."
E yeu no afermegui asso esser stranh, sino quar en aquo es sciensa e ajutori ad aquo que le metge artifec am la ma per curacio aministra.	"And I do not affirm that this is strange, but rather because in this there is science and help for the artisan physician who administers cure with his hand."
De las formas dels instrumentz que so necessaris a extrayre le fet.	"Of the forms of the instruments that are necessary to remove the child."
Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	"Mode of treatment by which the womb is opened:"
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	"This is the form of stretcher on which the patient lies, at the ends of which are two handles for turning over the patient."
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	"But this virtue ought to be more subtle than a strap, and made either of ivy or of oak wood."
E sia la latitut de quascun fust quays dos ditz e le marge de quascu amdos quays un dit, e la longitut de quascu es un palm e mig; e en le mieg loc de dos fustz so dos ajustaments de aquel meteys fustz les quals ja son fermatz, dels quals la longitut es la maytat de un palm e un pauc mes, e la latitut de quascu es quay dos ditz, o un pauc mes.	"And the width of each stick should be two fingers and the margin between each one also two fingers, and the length of each is one and a half palms; and in the middle of two sticks there are two adjustments for that same stick which are already fixed, the length of which is about one and three-quarters palms, and the width of each is two fingers or a little more."
E aquestz dos additamentz sian entromeses en la boca de la mayre per que sia uberta am aquels quan tu revolves las doas prescriptas virtigges.	"And these two adjustments are inserted into the mouth of the womb so that it can be opened with them when you turn the two prescribed virtues."
Forma autra semblant de aquela pus subtil e pus leugiera:	"Another form similar to this, but more subtle and lighter:"
Sia fayta de fustz de eba o de boys segon la semblansa de forceps.	"It should be made of ivy or oak wood according to the shape of forceps."
Mays empero en la extremitat de lu so dos additament ayssi cum vezes, e la longitut de aquels additament es quays un palm, e la latitut de quascu es dos ditz.	"But nevertheless at the end of it there are two adjustments like this, and the length of these adjustments is about one palm, and the width of each is two fingers."
E cum tu vols am aquels ubrir la mayre, lahoras tu fay cezer la femna sobre le lieyt les pes pendentz, ubert aquo que es entre las coyssas de lu.	"And when you want to open the womb with them, then you make the woman lie down on her back with her feet hanging down, and open what is between her thighs."
E aprop obre la tua ma am le instrument ayssi cum fas am forfexs engualment segon la quantitat que vols de la aprecio de la boca de la mayre entro que la metrona fassa so que vols.	"And then you open your hand with the instrument as you do with forceps to grasp according to the amount that you want of the mouth of the womb, so that it can fit where you want."
La forma de vertitge la qual diysero les antics:	"The form of virtue which they said in ancient times:"
Forma de impellent am le qual es empellit le fet:	"The form of pushing with which the fetus is pushed:"
Forma de amisidat2 am le qual es conterit le cap gran	"The form of sideways with which the large head is contained"
E es asemblat a forceps al qual so dentz en la extremitat, ayssi cum vezes, e alcunas veguadas es fayt lonc ayssi cum forceps segon aquesta forma, ayssi cum vezes, al qual so dentz ayssi cum dentz de ressegua am le qual es inscidit e conterit.	"And it is similar to forceps whose teeth are at the end like this, sometimes it is made long like forceps according to this form, like this, whose teeth are like the teeth of a comb with which it is inserted and contained."
Forma de amesidat pauc:	"The form of little sideways:"
Forma de unci havent una spina:	"The form of a hook having one spine:"
Forma de unci havent doas spinas:	"The form of a hook having two spines:"
Forma de forceps a la qual so dentz de cerra am le qual le cap del fet sia conterit:	"The form of forceps whose teeth are like those of a lock with which the head of the fetus can be contained."
Forma de spatum havent dos extremitatz am le qual le cap es abscindit:	"The form of spatula having two extremities with which the head is cut off:"
Forma de dos espatums latz:	"The form of two broad spatulas:"
Totz aquels instrumentz so excersitatz, e quan mes so multiplicadas las specias de aquel e so preparadas deves le artifexs, quant es pus leugier a la sua opperacio e pus aut deves les homes per la sua quantitat.	"All those instruments are exercised and when they are multiplied in their species and prepared by the craftsmen, it is easier to its operation and more skilled are the people because of their quantity."
E no obres de aquels instrumentz ja sia qua sia deves tu aparalhat, quar la necessitat de aquels no es excusabla.	"And do not make use of those instruments in any case, for the necessity of them is not excusable."
De extraccio de la segondina.	"On the extraction of the afterbirth."
Quan la segondina es retenguda deves le enfantament, lahoras cove que tu comandes a la malautae que retengua le sieu ale, e aprop fay aquela stornudar am condizi, e strenh la tua ma sobre la boca de lu e sobre las nars de lu, e si per aysso es defora eyssit, bo es.	"When the afterbirth is retained during childbirth, then you must command the midwife to retain her breath, and then make the woman sneeze with some condition, and stretch your hand over its mouth and nostrils, and if it comes out by this means, that's good."
E sino, lahoras tu pren una ola e perfora en la cuberta un trauc e pausa en aquela erbas ubrent la boca de la mayre, ayssi cum calament e ruda e anet e camamilla e scicados arabic e cassia lignea e santaurea.	"And if not, then you take a cloth and make a hole in it and place it over the mouth of the womb with these herbs burned: calamint, rue, fennel, camomile, saffron, and costus."
Totas aquestas erbas o alcunas de lor sian submersas en aygua en la ola, e pausa aquela sobre le foc.	"All these herbs or some of them are submerged in water in the cloth, and place it over the fire."
E aprop pausa una canula de canaviera en la boca de la mayre, e tengua aquela entro que la evapor vengua a la concavitat de la mayre.	"And then place a reed cane in the mouth of the womb, and keep it there until the vapor comes to the cavity of the womb."
E aprop fay aquela stornudar ayssi cum havem dit, e la segondina sira fora-getada am velocitat.	"And then make her sneeze as we have said, and the afterbirth will come out quickly expelled."
Mays si roman aprop aquesta curacio e no es eyssida, lahoras tu comanda a la matrona que submerge la sua ma sinistra en oli sizami o en micellage de altea, e aprop entrometa aquela en le conh e queresca am aquela la segondina, e cum aquela auras trobada, lahoras pren la e exten aquela pauc a pauc Mays si es annexsa en le preon de la mayre, lahoras entrometa la sua ma segon que havem recomtat, e quan aura trobat la segondina, extragua aquela petit a petit segon rectetut per so que la mayre no caja deves la atraccio vehement.	"But if this remedy remains and is not expelled, then you command the midwife to immerse her left hand in sesame oil or in althea emulsion, and then insert it into the vagina and search for the afterbirth with it. And when she has found it, then take it out little by little. But if it is attached to the lining of the womb, then insert your hand as we have recommended, and when you have found the afterbirth, extract it gradually according to rightness so that the woman does not suffer from violent traction."
Abantz cove que sia permudada als costatz dreyt e sinestre am facilitat.	"It is necessary that they be changed on the right and left sides with ease."
E aprop sia ajustat en la quantitat de atraccio, quar ela obedira e evasira de adhirencia.	"And then let the traction be adjusted in quantity, for it will obey and easily become detached."
E si la boca de la mayre es coartada, nos ja havem recomtat la curacio am sturnutacio e am medicacio de la ola am erbas.	"And if the mouth of the womb is obstructed, we have already recommended the remedy with sneezing and with medication of the cloth with herbs."
Mays si no es fora-getada am totas las causas las quals havem recomtadas, lahoras guarda te que no fetigues sobre aquela en iteracio de abstracio, mays empero cove que aquo que es eyssit de lu a la boca de la mayre lies a la coyssa de la femna, e aprop cristeriza aquela am enguent e tetrafarmacon; quar aquel fara poyrir aquela aprop alcus dias e sira dissolvuda e sira fora-getada.	"But if it is not expelled by all the causes which we have recommended, then be careful not to weary yourself in repeated attempts at abstraction, but what comes out of it into the mouth of the womb must be placed on a cloth near the woman's genitals and then dress it with ointment and tetrafarmacon; for that will make it disappear quickly, dissolved and expelled."
Mays quan se poyreys, es de lu elevada mala audor al cap, e al estomac, e aquo ledeys la malauta; e adonc cove que sian aministradas sub-fumiguacios e convenientz ad aquo.	"But when it has disappeared, there will be an evil odor rising to the head and stomach, and that will afflict the midwife. And then fumigations and suitable remedies should be administered."
Mays alcus dels Antics ja so esproatz sub-fumigacio de nazitort e de figuas seccas.	"But some of the Ancients used fumigation with narcissus and dried figs."
Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	"Form of an instrument with which women are fumigated during retention of menstruation and afterbirth:"
Sia fayta de veyre o de eram.	"It should be made of glass or brass."
E sia pausada la extremitat subtil en le conh e la extremitat ampla sobre le foc, e la sub-fumiguacio sia pausada sobre las brazas del foc.	"And the subtle extremity should be placed in the vagina and the wide one over the fire, and the fumigation should be applied to the embers of the fire."
E tengua aquela entro que sia consumida aquela sub-fumiguacio e itera·n autra.	"And keep that up until that fumigation is consumed and repeat another."
De curacio del cul del enfant no-perforat.	"On the treatment of the unperforated anus in childbirth."
Motz enfantz naysso e les culs de lu no so perforatz, les quals ya ciphac subtil e opilat.	"Many newborns have unperforated anuses which are very thin and closed."
Adonc cove a la matrona que perfore am le sieu dit aquel ciphac; e sino, perfora aquel am spatum agut, e guarda se que no toque le lacert.	"So the midwife must perforate that with her finger; if not, then perforate it with a sharp probe, taking care not to touch the nerve."
E aprop pause sobre aquel lana enfusa en vi e oli; e aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia senat.	"And then place lanolin soaked in wine and oil over it; and dress it with ointment until healed."
Mays si temes que sia opilat, lahoras pausa en le trauc una canula per motz dias, e osta la quan le enfant voldra degerir.	"But if you fear that it may close again, then place a probe cannula in the hole for several days and remove it when the child wants to defecate."
E ja accideys oppilacio del cul per consolidacio de plagua o de apostema; adonc cove que aquela consolidacio sia inscidida, e aprop sia curada am aquo que avem dit de la curacio e del plom.	"And sometimes the anus closes due to consolidation of a phlegm or an abscess; then that consolidation should be incised and then dressed with what we have said about the treatment and lead."
De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	"On the treatment of fistulas that form in the rectum."
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	"The fistulas that develop in the lower part of the rectum are large and thick, which develop near the anus outside or in the space between the two buttocks."
E es una fistula o motas.	"And it is one fistula or many."
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz.	"And with that thickness being old and running with moist white humidity or subtle pus, and sometimes there are penetrating parts from these fistulas."
E aquelas penetrantz so conogudas per aquo que es eyssit de aquelas per la egressio e per ventosetat; e alcunas vetz use le malaute de egressio, e fort leu es eyssit de aquelas verm.	"And these penetrating parts are recognized by what comes out of them through their exit and windiness; and sometimes the disease itself shows the exit, and sometimes it is clearly evident when worms come out."
E so de aquelas fistulas alcunas veguadas en l’espazi penetrantz entro a la vesica, e entro al meat de la vergua; e so de aquelas penetrantz entro la junctura de la coyssa e entro al notz de la coeta.	"And sometimes there are penetrating parts from those fistulas entering the bladder and the glans of the penis; and these penetrating parts enter the junction of the vulva and into the opening of the vagina."
E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	"And that which distinguishes a penetrating fistula from one that does not penetrate is this: when you insert your finger into the anus and find no tortuosity in the fistula, then it is not penetrating."
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	"If it is tortuosity in that area, then insert into that subtle vein of lead or horsehair until you feel the vein or hair under your finger."
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	"If you do not find anything at all and there is no evidence of obstruction, inflammation or wind, as mentioned earlier, then you should know that it is not penetrable, and therefore cease treatment."
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	"And when the fistula is penetrable into the bladder or into the urethra, its meaning is the escape of urine from there and the prevention of it, as this location is well-established in medicine."
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	"But if it is penetrable into the joint of the hip or into the bone and there is pain in the region, its sign is that the vein has entered here, unless it is tortuosity within the bone, causing pain at the outset. And from this, it always results in gangrene; and no remedy helps there, nor is it established with ointment."
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	"And in all those penetrable fistulas there is no cure at all, and the treatment of them is the fruitless labour and folly of foolish physicians."
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	"But in that which is not penetrable and is not old, healing with iron is hoped for according to what you will advise, based on what I have already said."
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	"And it is that the disease passes between your thighs and mostly on the two sides, raising its swellings within them. The hips are inclined towards the belly of it, and it enters with a tendency to plumb or earth if there is tortuosity in the fistula, so you should know the place where the vein has entered."
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	"And if that one feels the disease around his buttocks, then it is necessary for you to insert your little finger into the anus."
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	"And if you feel the vein already entering uncovered with your little finger, unless you feel something between the little finger and that flesh or skin, then you should know for certain that it is penetrable; and therefore do not treat that one, because there is no cure for him, as we have said."
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	"But nevertheless some say that some men are cured."
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	"And of the treatment by which it is hoped to obtain benefit from it, it is that you ignite cautery subtly according to the width of the fistula, as it has been said before, and insert that burning into the fistula until it reaches around the anus; and then repeat that two or three times until you know that all those flesh joined by the fistula are burnt, which resemble the quill of a bird's feather."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	"And then dress that with compresses wrapped in bandages until all those burnt flesh have cooled down, and also treat it with medicines that generate and solidify the flesh. And if it is healed, well and good; but if not, then it will never be healed by any other treatment."
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	"And if the vein enters but does not penetrate within the little finger which is in the anus, and between that and the vein which is veiled by skin or flesh, and sometimes the fistula runs along the surface of the thigh, then cut off the thigh from the beginning of the fistula. And you see it being cut with the vein, until the section reaches the place where the extremity of the vein has entered. And through the vein it will be freed and cured."
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	"And then cleanse those flesh joined by the fistula which resemble a bird's feather quill, and do not break them off for any reason."
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	"But if there is a flow of blood which comes between you and your operation when you are cutting those flesh, then the best thing to do is cauterize with fire or with an acute medicine, because cautery with fire has two good habits: it is the burning of those joined flesh, and the ablation of blood, exsiccation of humidity."
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	"And then dress it with compresses wrapped in bandages or in clean cloth until that place becomes sound. And then afterwards treat the wound with hard and solidifying medicine."
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	"And such medicines are those which have astringent and drying properties; when they are applied, the wound is restored and it will never be inflamed again."
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	"But if the fistula has already entered into the anus and is elongated along the surface of the body, then insert your little finger into the anus and search with it."
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	"And therefore if you feel the vein and between it and yourself there is veiled skin or flesh which prevents penetration, then it is not an operation but according to faith and hope."
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	"And therefore in this case there are three ways to proceed: either cauterize it as we have said; or dry it out until you achieve the concavity of it so that you can insert your finger into it and perform the proposed cure. And do not proceed with cutting because you might wound the lappet containing the anus, which would cause great suffering for the patient without his consent. And then dress it as we have said because it will heal quickly. Or else elongate that veil and clean out the pus from there near the anus as we have said, either with your finger or with another instrument of pointed extremity. And then cleanse those flesh joined by the fistula which are in the section where you can perform cauterization. And finally strive to make the restoration of all the wound with a cut, and if the upper opening is not solidified, and the fistula remains open at the partition of the anus, then it will cause further suffering."
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	"And when the fistula is finished in this manner: it is when you insert your finger into the fistula, and on the side of the anus around the surface of the body with the thigh, then take a needle with a perforated extremity which is like the one used for preparing hearts in this form:"
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	"and insert it into that vein wrapped with a thread or around those veins, and then insert your finger with the thread into the fistula until you achieve the concavity of it."
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	"But if it is penetrating into the margin of the anus deeply, then you pull out the thread from that wound in such a way that you insert your little finger into the anus. And then extract the extremity of the thread and join both extremities together. Then cut each one separately, and leave it like that for one day or two days. And when you see that the thread has become incorporated into the flesh, then cut it carefully until those flesh which are between both extremities of the thread have fallen off."
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	"And then dress the wound until it is solidified and healed."
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	"But if the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate, in whatever way you are prepared to do so, but not too deeply into the anus because you should not do this yourself lest you wound the lappet. And then dress it until it is healed."
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	"The form of the spatula with spines used to open the fistula is like this: its curvature is very sharp and the other edge is not sharp so that you do not wound anything unnecessarily, as it happens often."
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	"On the suture of hemorrhoids which bleed at the incision of those."
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	"There are two kinds of hemorrhoids: one is between the buttocks resembling these coals; the other is when those are like grapes."
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	"And of those there are small and large ones; some always bleed and are one; others are many and are outside the anus at its extremities."
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	"But those which are outside the anus are due to little humidity, from which yellow water or a little blood with continuous discharge comes out and they appear according to the color of the body."
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	"The cure for this condition, which affects the heart, is to order the patient to sit up and press their chest until the heart appears."
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	"Then you will take hold of one with your fingers or whatever you have at hand, and carefully cut where their roots are."
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	"However, if your fingers are not strong enough because of the humidity and softening of those parts, then you should take them with rough cloth or cotton or a piece of woolen flannel, extract them with your hands, and carefully cut where their roots are. Then sprinkle some dry powder on that incision so that it may burn those parts instead of cauterizing."
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"And then treat those parts with the other cure until they are healed."
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	"And if the wound does not close, then you should cleanse the patient with a cleansing agent that causes a small bite. Let it be washed with water from the heart until it closes gently when the patient squeezes."
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the hemorrhoids are outside of the anus, then their cause is slight, and it is sufficient for you to take them with your fingernail or grasp them with a small forceps and cut them. Then treat them with water as previously mentioned until they are healed."
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	"And for one who has had an incision made beforehand, you should administer suturing of them in this manner: Take some linen thread and wrap it around a needle. Then insert the needle into the skin at the edges above where the hemorrhoids are located. Next, make the needle penetrate into the other part of the skin at the edge below. Wrap the two ends of the linen thread around the needle in such a way that they cross each other laterally. Then tie the hemorrhoid with great tension and cut off the excess linen thread."
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	"And do this for all of them, leaving one alone and not tying it, so that the superfluous blood may flow out from there."
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	"And then apply a cloth soaked in rose oil or wax over the anus, and also apply some on the belly. Command the patient to keep quiet."
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	"And then leave that alone until it heals. And when it has healed, treat it with an ointment or another cure so that it may be healed."
De curacio de fistulas.	"About the treatment of fistulas."
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	"Dryness or constriction of nature happens frequently."
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	"And if those are old and not useful in that medicine, then you must remove them with the point of a spatula or your fingernail until they are wet and remove the pus on top, which prevents consolidation; and then cure them once they have consolidated."
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	"Then remove those with violent scraping until the first blood comes out and they are raw; then cure them once they are healed."
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	"The key to curing leprosy is this:"
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	"Know that leprosy, the key disease, is not recognizable by any reddening of the skin like a pinhead; rather it appears throughout the body but most notably on the sides of the feet and hands, where pain often occurs."
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	"And then it is necessary that this be inscribed on what is in the circuit of the key and held with forceps or tweezers and removed from its root; then cure it."
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	"And if you wish, cauterize the second one that preceded it on its head."
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	"However, a wart is a small, rough, flesh-colored elevation with a round, indented surface that appears most often on the faces of children."
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	"And its treatment is to stretch and incise it, or scrape it off with a file or pumice stone until it bleeds."
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	"If you wish, cauterize it with fire or an acute medicine, as we have said."
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	"And now that these warts and non-warts have been eradicated using the instrument that I call 'the scoop.'"
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	"However, a mole is a small, fatty or flesh-colored elevation with a rough surface that appears frequently on the forehead. When it is rubbed with a finger, it resembles the bite of an ant; they are found all over the body."
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	"And its treatment is to take a quill of an owl or vulture feather, thick and sharp, place it on the mole so that the circle of the quill contains the mole's perimeter; then rotate your hand with the quill so as to incise what is around the mole, pressing down on the skin. Then eradicate the mole from its root."
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	"And if you wish, do it with a cautery iron or red-hot needle in this way:"
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	"Make the tip of the needle thin, blunt (i.e., not perforated), and covered with something so that when you hold it, its point is smooth and easy to rotate."
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	"And if you wish, cauterize the mole according to what was said earlier in the chapter on cautery regarding the treatment of warts."
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	"On the shapes of the instruments used for cautery."
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	"Sometimes cautery is performed using silver or lead or molten iron or brass; and sometimes it is done with small or large instruments according to what is available. For example, the instrument used for treating young children should be small. And those whose handles are crooked or bent, their cauteries should also be small."
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	"The shape of a large cautery with few points:"
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	"The head of the cautery needle at its top should be wide like this; and it should have the same distance from where the purse is tied to where it ends."
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	"And the bottom end of it that is inserted into the handle should be blunt (i.e., not open) but pointed at its tip, tapering to a sharpness. And on one side there should be two holes and on the other side one hole, with the width of the holes being according to the thickness of the rays, with larger ones being smaller."
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	"And the purse in which bladder medicines from beasts or sheep wool are placed should have a root of one palm [approximately 7.62 cm]."
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	"And it should be pierced with many holes around it, so that when it is rotated, the space between the holes is equal to the thickness of your finger."
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	"And then insert strong, hot iron wire through the holes of the purse. After inserting it, fit the purse onto the cautery instrument and tighten it securely at the top of the cautery between two points with great force. Then cauterize using this method for each hole: But the key to cauterizing in this way is that you should fill the purse with the medicine, heated according to the tolerance level of the patient; be careful not to make it too hot or too cold."
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	"And then have the patient lie on their back and raise their buttocks up. Place a cloth or towel underneath them to protect them from soiling themselves. Then apply oil or egg white or fenugreek mucilage or similar substance to the tip of the cautery instrument, insert it into the anus gently, then have the assistant take the purse, squeeze it with both hands and press it vigorously until everything inside the cautery is expelled from the bowel. Then remove the cautery instrument and let the patient lower their buttocks back down."
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	"If the medicine forces them to evacuate strongly, have them hold it as long as they can. And if they sleep with that in place for the whole night, it will be more effective in its action."
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	"But if you cauterize someone for disorders of the belly with evacuation and bleeding from there, then repeat the cautery procedure until they are healed."
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	"And if there are hemorrhoids or bleeding fistulas in the anus, then use a small and pointed cautery, such as those used for cauterizing children."
De curacio de las plaguas.	"On treating plagues:"
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	"I have already mentioned in the division of plague treatments what was necessary for this book. And I will now explain how to treat them using me and medicines according to their respective requirements."
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	"So I say that plagues are differentiated according to the condition in which they occur, and according to the location where the plague occurs."
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	"And the causes why plague often occurs are as follows: such as fracture of bone, or incision with knife or spear, or cut with sword, or blow with lance, club, or arrow, or similar things from many causes."
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	"But the plagues that occur in different parts of the body are as follows: such as plague that occurs on the head, neck, chest, abdomen, buttocks, and similar ones on the limbs."
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	"And I am recounting here the treatment of some plagues because this reasoning and rule can also apply to other plagues."
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	"I will begin with simple head wounds, as the treatment of compound ones will come at the beginning of the third chapter."
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	"So I say that when a simple wound occurs on the head and it is not a fracture, then consider this: if it was caused by a blow from a stone or similar object and only the scalp has been affected, and it is a large wound and you fear that there may be an abscess forming, then immediately perform a cephalic trepanation and flebotomy on the head. Do not delay in doing this, unless there is some other reason preventing flebotomy, especially if the blood that has flowed from the wound is sparse."
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	"And perform the trepanation on the opposite side of the parted wound. Keep the patient from exertion and strong drink, as well as heavy food."
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	"But if you prohibit any cause because of the minuteness of it, then let him have only light food and avoid meat and wine."
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	"And pause on the wound. If an abscess forms, cut into it with roasted rose oil or wine mixed with tragacanth gum."
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	"If you are certain of an abscess, then place hot water over the inflammation if it is recent, mixed with its blood and air has not changed that powder which I will recommend soon."
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	"If the air has already changed there, then place hot water over the ulcer until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	"If the wound is large or made by a sword cut and does not have its edges aligned due to dust, then align them with stitches according to my recommendation for wound stitching."
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	"If the wound is already open and exposed to the bone and only has slight swelling rather than retention, then incision should be made there and appropriate care given to the wound using medicines. The flesh should also be restored appropriately in place of sutures, and the patient commanded to abstain from foods that are coarse: cabbage, beans, peas, lentils and similar things, until recovery is complete."
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	"If you find putrefaction in the wound and it does not adhere to the bone, then incise all that is putrid, remove it, and dress the wound appropriately."
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	"If in these wounds there is an artery or vein from which blood flows profusely and cannot be stopped by medicines, then inquire about the artery. If you find that it has not been incised, then incise it with a scalpel or ligate it; if necessary, cauterize until the bleeding stops."
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	"If these wounds are simple and small, then their cause is light. Therefore, you should powder them with this powder, so that they may be consolidated before the air can change them."
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	"And the method for making this powder is as follows: take one part oil of sesame, two parts dragon's blood resin, three parts myrrh resin; grind them all together and sift it. Use this powder to fill the wound and constrain it with good constriction until it adheres well and coagulates with the blood."
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	"And then apply this powder to it from above and leave it alone. Do not remove it while it is still adhering, because the medicine has not yet been eradicated from there until it is healed."
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	"Sometimes you can use only cauterization when sesame oil and dragon's blood resin are not available to you."
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	"And this same operation should be performed on large wounds when it is appropriate to place them over those and they are straitened, especially fresh wounds with their blood, which have not yet been altered by the air."
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	"But if the air has altered them, especially during summer time, then it is not appropriate to use this powder. In that case, treat those wounds with what we have said earlier: apply some suitable ointments over them, or use flour of barley mixed with water and honey until they become putrid; and then treat them with the other cure until they are healed."
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	"But if a fracture of the bone occurs in a wound that is small, then you should treat it with this [powder]."
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	"And I say that the treatment for fractures of the head is given above."
De las plaguas del col.	"Regarding wounds of the neck:"
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	"But if a wound occurs on the neck, there is no difference in treatment between it and a simple head wound."
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	"But if the nerve or artery of the neck is cut, then if it is a nerve, there is no other means than to avoid treatment with this [powder] that causes violent coagulation, such as vitriol and similar substances which harm nerves."
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	"And do not apply any cautery to the wound for any reason, because the substance of nerves is fragile and their continuity is with the brain, which is the master of all members."
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	"And if it is treated with light medicines in this way, such as washing the wound with warm water, sometimes infused in uncooked or cooked oil, and then applying honey when washed with warm water and other minor ointments according to this method, and moistening them."
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	"But if the wound is large, then perform suturing or fasten the lips of it, and afterwards treat it with this powder until it is healed."
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	"But if the wound has depth or if it occurs in a low-lying part that becomes putrid, then pierce it at its deepest point."
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	"But if an artery is cut in the wound and bleeding occurs, then separate or dry it out, ligate it, or cauterize it if necessary."
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	"But if the vertebrae of the spine have been severed completely and the veins of the neck are preserved, then approximate the lips of the wound over the spine with suturing without touching that part. Then elevate it gently and reduce it to its natural shape. Afterwards strengthen it with decent traction, leave it alone for a few days; and afterwards treat it with ointments that have coagulating and stimulating properties until it is healed."
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	"But if the wound has already reached the bone, then strike it with a mallet. And if there are fragments of bone in it, remove all that you can. But what cannot be removed, leave it alone until the wound becomes putrid and separates, and its inflammation is relieved."
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	"And if the wound is fresh, then powder it with the powder that I have recommended to you."
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	"But if there is a fistula in the wound, then treat it with what will be remembered shortly in its proper chapter."
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	"Regarding wounds of the neck or similar ones that occur between the shoulders and are made with a sword, knife, lance, or similar instruments:"
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	"If it is a wound made by a lance or knife, and its depth varies according to the force of the blow, then consider whether there is any wind sound coming from the wound when the patient breathes. If so, know that the wound is mortal."
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	"And if it is not deep and the wound is fresh with its own blood, then pause in it with the first-hour powder, but do not compress it so that the blood does not accumulate in its depth and return to the heart causing harm. Instead, apply an attractive ointment and wash it twice a day."
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	"And if the ointment is not available, then place a piece of cotton in the wound to prevent anything from flowing out, and make sure that the patient sleeps on their side so that what has accumulated flows out."
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	"But if three days or more have passed and no spasm, heart palpitations, or lung constriction has occurred in the patient, and other conditions are good, then know that the wound is safe. And so treat it with bandages and other treatments until it is healed."
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	"But if its healing is delayed and much time has passed, then know that a fistula has already formed. Therefore treat it according to the chapter on fistulas."
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	"And if the wound is caused by a cut from a sword or knife and is simple on the surface of the skin or flesh, then treat it with what has been previously mentioned about suturing if it is large, or with powder if it is small."
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	"But if the wound has already reached the bone and pieces of it have been cut off, then turn the wound over and try to extract those pieces if they are separate."
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	"But if they are not separate, then leave them alone until the wound becomes putrid, for their extraction will be easier that way."
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	"And regarding other accidental wounds in the other members, the remedy in treatment is the same as what has been said."
De las plaguas del ventre.	"Regarding abdominal wounds:"
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	"The condition that occurs in the abdomen is either large, small, or medium-sized."
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	"Regarding large ones, sometimes the bowel or nerve of the bowel comes out, causing an entrance into them and necessitating their suturing with great care and subtlety."
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	"When extraction is requested, it is difficult to achieve by other methods, and especially if the reduction of these is more difficult, unless you quickly remove the intrusion from its place, for if it opens and becomes enlarged because the entrance was difficult."
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	"The best extraction is through the middle, for in that case it is easy to reduce the intestines, unlike in the two species mentioned above."
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	"And you should know that there are four ways to suture the abdomen, but two of these sutures are common and applicable to other wounds on the body."
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	"And the other two sutures are more specific to the abdomen, although they can be applied to other wounds as well."
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	"I will now recount each one with its exposition and explanation."
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	"Therefore I say that when the wound is small and some cause of the intestines comes out through it, and it is difficult to reduce it, there are two ways: either because of the smallness of the disruption, as we have said, or when inflammation has come to the intestines due to the coldness of the air."
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	"And therefore, when this is the case, you should then scrape that until you immerse a sponge or cloth wet in hot water alone, or you take water with squinant, cyperus, and spice, and bandage it around that part of the intestines so that the inflammation may be resolved."
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	"And sometimes you will find this useful in cases where there is stricturing, and it is better that the water alone be used for resolving the inflammation."
