E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	"Therefore, once the inflammation has been resolved, you should then moisten the intestines with water in which common salt and mallows have been boiled, for this relieves the pain caused by it."
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	"But if the pain has not been relieved by this treatment, then carefully cut the disruption a little with an instrument with which it is incised, and remove theemorrhoids."
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	"And the primary treatment is better, when it is proper that it not be cut, and there is no need to cut except in case of necessity or deficiency."
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	"What is the shape of the instrument?"
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	"The one end of it is cut sharp, and the other not sharp, and the tip is subtle, but not as subtle as a spatula, rather it is somewhat obtuse."
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	"And therefore, once the wound has been enlarged and extends outside the intestines, it is necessary that its reduction be according to the shape of nature itself in its proper place, if this is possible. For this is better."
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	"But when the disruption is large and it is in the lower part of the belly, then you should make the sick person lie on his back, raise his buttocks as high as his head; but if it is in the upper part of the belly, then you should raise his head and raise his feet as high as the sides."
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	"And likewise if the disruption is in one of the two sides of the belly, then always pay attention and consideration to this, so that the side where there is the wound may be raised higher than the other."
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	"And this you should administer in both large wounds and medium-sized ones."
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	"And in small wounds, pay attention to what you have prepared, and especially that the person who ministers it be among your most skilled, who should hold the disruption entirely with his hand and adjust its lips together, and so that he may cover from this one to that which sews without any other cause."
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	"And this is the common manner of suturing: first take the needle, or count of needles according to the amount of the width of the wound; and then leave the end of the disruption on the finger, and thread the needle once, but do not put silk in both ends of the thread. With two ends of the silk, which is left outside the thread, enter it into that part until you have brought it out from there; and you already have four orders."
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	"And then thread with doubled silk around the needle, and sometimes from two parts together, and then join the two lips and the wound by proper joining; and then leave the thickness of the finger and insert another needle into it, and then tie that with silk in the same way as the first needle was tied. And do not cease doing this until you have completed all the contraction of the wound."
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	"And let the needles be medium between thickness and subtlety, for the thin needles easily cut into the flesh; but thick ones are difficult to insert into the thread. Therefore they should be medium in subtlety and thickness."
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	"And it is not necessary that the needle be inserted into both ends of the thread very close together, for fear that the flesh should be easily cut and that the wound may open before its consolidation."
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	"And do not make sutures too long so that the wound is not prevented from consolidation."
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	"And then cut the ends of the needles so that they do not bother the sick person while he is sleeping. And you will put powdered incense on the sutures from both sides, which should hold the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the wound has already consolidated."
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	"And these kinds of sutures with needles in whatever manner are more convenient for small wounds, since it is enough to use one needle or two or around them."
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	"But the second suture is more common: and it is that you administer with sutures the four ends of the thread and both ends of the silk in one time, with a needle on which there is silk wrapped in subtlety and thickness."
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	"And then when the needle has penetrated these four ends, reduce the needle from that same part where you began, so that the silk may draw back from the uppermost part of the wound to the bottom, so that the suture may be like a seam on cloth with which the threads are tightened."
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	"And put between each suture the quantity of the thickness of the little finger."
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	"And this is what people know."
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	"And with this suture I sewed a wound which had been accidentally inflicted on a man in his belly, who had been wounded with a dagger, and the disruption of the wound was more than a palm; it had exited from the intestines around two palms from the middle of the intestine, and the disruption was in the middle of the member. And then I reduced that after the intestines had been forced out by the wound for twenty-four hours."
E la plagua fo consolidada en le spazi de xv dias o entorn, e curegui aquel e es sanat; e aprop aquo visquec per motz ans, e es conversat en las suas disposicios.	"And the wound was consolidated in the space of fifteen days or thereabouts, and he was cured. And he lived for many years after that, and is still alive in his usual condition."
E les autres metges havian jutgat que no fora sanat; e per miracle foc, quar yeu no curegui aquel am enguent, quar era en loc en le qual enguent no era atrobat ni deguna medicina, mays pausegui sobre la plagua coto viel dos veguadas lo dia e ablucio assiduo am aygua de mel entro que foc sanat.	"And the other doctors had judged that he would not be healed. And by miracle it was so, for I did not cure him with an ointment, because there was no ointment nor any medicine to be found in that place; but twice a day I put a cloth moistened with honey water on the wound until he was healed."
Mays yeu diyre dos specias de sutura proprias segon narracio de Paraula.	"But I say two kinds of sutures proper according to the narration of the Word."
E es que tu comenses am sutura de la codena, e entrometas agulha de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz.	"And it is that you begin with suturing the thread and insert the needle from without into within."
E donc cum la agulha penetra en la codena e en aquel meteys lacertz segon rectetut e en longetut de tot le cos, e layssa la extremita del ciphac en le qual has entromesa la agulha; e fay penetrar en la autra extremitat la agulha de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo en l’autra extremitat del mihat.	"And then when the needle penetrates into the thread and in that same part of the flesh according to its breadth and length throughout all the body, leave the end of the silk on which you have inserted the needle; and make the needle penetrate from within outwards in the other extremity of the member."
E don cum tu auras fayta aquela penetrar, lahoras tu fay aquela penetrar autra veguada en aquela meteyssa extremitat del mihat de la partida deforo a la partida dedintz; e leyssa la extramitat del ciphac que es en aquest latz, e fay penetrar la agulha en l’autra extremitat de la partida dedintz a la partida deforo.	When you have caused it to penetrate once, then cause it to penetrate again in that same spot of the right side outside to inside; and leave the extremity of the spleen which is on this side, and cause the needle to penetrate into the other extremity of the inside from the outside.
E fay penetrar am aquela la tua penetracio am la qual fas aquela penetrar en le ciphac en la extremitat del mirat la qual es en la partida de lu entro que tot aquel penetre.	And cause that penetration with which you cause it to penetrate in the spleen at the extremity of the mirror which is inside that everything may penetrate.
E aprop comensa de aquest meteys costat e cus aquel am la extremitat que es del ciphac en l’autra latz, e extratz la agulha de la codena la qual penetrec, e aprop redutz aquela en aquela codena e cos la extremitat del ciphac que es en l’autra costat am aquesta extramitat del mirat; e extratz aquela de la codena la qual es de part de lu.	And start from this same side and count with the extremity which is of the spleen on the other side, and withdraw the needle from the channel which you have penetrated, and again insert it into that channel and pass through the extremity of the spleen which is on the other side with this extremity of the mirror; and withdraw it from the channel which is towards them.
E fay aquo una veguada e autra, e fay aquo una veguada aprop autre veguada entro que tu cozes tot aquo que es deforo segon aquel eysemple.	And do this once or twice, and do this once again if you wish to do everything that is outside according to that example.
E la suma de aquesta manieyra de sutura es que tu cozes am sutura de pellicies am la qual cozo las pels, enayssi que tu cozes le ciphac una veguada de la part de la extremitat de la codena, e que leysses aquela autra veguada entro que la ajas complida.	And the sum of this manner of suturing is that you should suture with a suturing of the skin in such a way that you should suture the spleen once from the side of the channel extremity, and leave the other side until it has been completed.
Mays la segonda specia de sutura propria la qual dieys eyssament Gualia , e aquest es de sermo de lu e per lu recomtat, es que tu cozas aquela segon semilitut am la qual alcus medicantz cozo aquela, enayssi que agreguan tota partida a la sua compar partida a lu convenient per natura; e aplican la extremitat de autre de lu e la extremitat del mirat al autra extremitat de lu, e aquo es fayt segon que yeu a tu recomti.	Moreover, the second species of suturing which Guilia describes explicitly, and this is about it and for its recommendation, is that you should suture it according to semilunar fashion with which some surgeons suture it, so that they join every part to its corresponding part according to nature; and they apply the extremity of one side and the extremity of the mirror to the other extremity of it, and this is done as you recommend.
Cove que tu fiques la agulha en la extremitat del mirat a tu propdana de la partida deforo, e fassas aquela penetrar a la partida dedintz en aquel sol, e leysses dos extremitatz del ciphac; e aprop revolveys la agulha e fay aquela penetrar de foro a la dedintz en dos extremitatz del ciphac.	Certainly you should leave the needle in the extremity of the mirror at your proximity to the outside part, and make it penetrate into the inside part in that same sun, and leave both extremities of the spleen; and again turn the needle and make it penetrate from outside to inside through both extremities of the spleen.
E aprop revolveys aquelas cascunas, e fay penetrar quascunas de la partida dededintz entro a la partida deforo en dos extremitatz del mirat autras que so en le latz contrari.	And again turn those shuttles, and make them penetrate from the inside part into the outside part through both extremities of the mirror except those which are on the opposite side.
E aquesta manieyra de sutura es milhor de la sutura comuna leugiera, e es sutura de la qual precedic rememoracio.	And this manner of suturing is better than the common light suturing, and it is the suturing of which a preceding mention has been made.
Aquest es le sermo de Gualia	This is the speech of Guilia
E mays le diyssero alcus, sutura del ventre es rectificada am dos agulhas, so es que tu entrometas en aquestas a quascunas un fiel, e comensa am intromiccio de agulha de aquo que es deves tu, e fay aquela penetrar entro al autra latz segon sutura de aquels les quals cozo les cuers engualment.	And some say that abdominal suturing is corrected with two needles, so that you should put in these shuttles a filet, and begin with the needle insertion of what is required by you, and make it penetrate into the other side according to the suturing of those who suture the hearts equally.
E sapias que quan disrupcio es en le mieg loc del ventre, lahoras la sutura de lu es pus difficil que dels autres locs del ventre.	And know that when there is a disruption in the middle of the abdomen, at that time the suturing of it is more difficult than in other parts of the abdomen.
Mays le juguament de medicacio de plagua es jutgament de las autras plaguas.	But the treatment of a wound is judged by other wounds.
La qual causa es quar quan tu consieguas la plagua recent am le sieu sanc denant que l’ayre altera aquela, e reduses le budel e cozes aquela e aptas aquela decentment, lahoras pausa sobre aquela polvera encarnativa.	"The cause is that when you constrain the wound recently with its own blood before the air alters it, and reduce the intestine, close it, and prepare it properly, then place powdered cinnabar on it."
E si le ayre ja ha alterada la plagua, lahoras pausa sobre aquela alcus enguentz les quals so a tu presens entro que fassan peyra dura e cajan les fiels, e sian consolidatz ciphac e mirat; e aprop cura aquela ayssi cum es la curacio de las autras plaguas entro que sia sanat.	"If the air has already altered the wound, then place this powder on it with great care using these cloths that are nearby to make sure it penetrates deep and sticks well."
Mays si a tu no so presens las medicinas, lahoras pausa sobre aquela tantost, pus que comensa a getar brac, coto viel, e permuta aquel dos veguadas le dia, ayssi cum a tu e ensenhat, entro que sia sanat, quar tu no indigeysses de autra medicacio en motas disposicios quan las plaguas so simplas.	"But if you are not present, then apply the powder immediately, because it begins to heal within three days and changes every two days, as you have taught, until it is healed. For you do not need other medications in many cases when wounds are simple."
Mays si tu temes que la plagua comunique en lesio als membres principals, lahoras cove que tu submergas lana leon en oli de trempada qualiditat, o en oli rozat, e pausa aquela en le circuit dels locs que so entre les angonas e dejos las aysselas.	"But if you fear that the wound may communicate with injury to the principal members, then you should submerge lion's wool in good quality olive oil or rose oil and apply it to the area between the joints and leave it on."
E si sent dolor o putrefaccio en les sieus budels, quar motas veguadas aquo s’endeve, lahoras cristeriza aquel am vi stiptic negre tebe, e majorment si la poyredura es pervenguda en le budel e es fayta exitura penetrant entro la conquavitat de lu.	"And if there is pain or putrefaction in its bowels, which often happens, then crystallize this with black treacle wine and more so if the putrefaction has reached the bowel and cannot be expelled."
E sapias que aquela que es del budel gros es de pus leugiera sanacio que aquela que es en les budels subtils.	"And know that a wound in the large intestine is of lighter healing than one in the small intestines."
E es de dificil sanacio quar le budel le qual es apelat “gegunu” no recep sanacio de plagua que caja en lu de tot; e aquo es per la gran multitut de venas que so en lu e per la magnitut de lu que so en aquelas, e per subtilitat del cos de aquel, e per propinquitat de aquel a natura de nervis.	"And it is difficult to heal because the intestine called 'gegunu' does not receive healing of any wound that falls into it; and this is due to the great multitude of veins that are in it and the magnitude of its substance, and for the subtlety of its body and its proximity to the nature of nerves."
Mays si aquo que procezeys de la plagua es la tela, e conseguas aquela recent, redutz aquela segon la tua rectetut am la qual reduzes les budels engualment.	"But if what proceeds from the wound is tissue and you obtain that recent, then reduce it according to your discretion with which you also reduce intestines equally."
Mays si es passat a lu spazi e ja es feyt vert o negre, lahoras que tu strenguas aquela am fiel sobre le loc que es denigrat de lu, per so que vengua fluxs de sanc, quar en la tela so venas e arterias.	"But if it has passed into blackness and is becoming green or black, then strengthen it with faith over the area that has been discolored by it, so that fluxes of blood may come forth, for in the tissue are veins and arteries."
E aprop inscideys aquo que es otra aquel liament, e pausa dos extremitatz del fiel pendentz de la partida dejos de la plagua foro lu, per que sobre tu sia alleujada la atraccio de lu deves le cazement de la tela e emissio del brac de la plagua.	"And appropriately cut away that which is other than the membrane and leave two extremities of the thread hanging from the edge of the wound, so that over you there may be alleviated the attraction of it you must remove the scab of the tissue and emission of the branch of the wound."
Rememoracio de las plaguas quan accideysso en le budel.	"Remembrance of wounds when they occur in the intestine."
Quan accideys disrupcio en le budel e es petita, lahoras es possibla que sia resteurada en alcus homes, per aysso quar yeu vi aquel le qual era stat plaguat en le sieu ventre am percussio de lansa et era la plagua de la part dreyta del stomac, e la plagua era antiquada e fayta fistula, e eyssic de lu gestio e ventositat.	"When disruption occurs in the intestine and it is small, then it is possible that it may be restored in some people, for this reason: one man who was wounded in his belly with a lance blow and the wound was on the right side of the stomach, and the wound was old and had no fistula, and from it there was management and windiness."
Adonc yeu pansegui la curacio de lu ja sia que no era confizat en la sanacio de lu, mays cessegui subtiliar aquel entro que foc sanat e le loc es consolidat.	"Then I followed the treatment of it although it was not certain in its healing, but I ceased to subtiliate that which was inside it and the area had consolidated."
E yeu pus que vi le loc ja consolidat, timegui sobre le malaute que endevengues sobre lu accident de mal en le sieu ventre; e no endevenc alcu per aquo mal accident e romas en las suas milhos disposicios mangant e bevent, e aprop entrec en banh e es exercitat en sos ditz.	"And I put that I saw the area already consolidated, so I placed on him a remedy for the pain that occurred over his belly wound; and no one else suffered from this accident, and they remained in their best condition eating and drinking, and appropriately entered into baths and were exercised in their deeds."
E ja diysero alcus experimentados que quan endeve plagua en le budel, e es petita, lahoras cove que sia liada segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas fromiguas de grans caps; e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua e pausa una fromigua de aquelas que aja la boca uberta sobre las doas labias de la plagua; donc quan pren sobre aquelas e strenh la sua boca, abscindeys le cap de lu, quar adhereys e no es dissolvut.	"And some experienced ones have said that when there is wound in the intestine and it is small, then it is necessary to ligate it in this manner: And take figs with large heads; and appropriately adjust both lips of the wound and place one of those which has its mouth open over both lips of the wound. Then when it adheres there and tightens its mouth, cut off its head for it adheres and is not dissolved."
E aprop pausa autra formigua prop la primieyra, e no cesses aquo a far am formiguas una aprop autra segon la quantitat de tota la plagua.	"And appropriately place another fig near the first one, and do not cease doing this with figs until the quantity of the entire wound is filled."
E aprop reduzeys aquela e cos la plagua; e romanguan aquels caps annexces en le budel entro que·l budel sia sanat; e no accideys al malaute degun nocument.	"And appropriately reduce it and sew the wound shut; and those attached heads remain inside the intestine until the intestine is healed; and no one suffers from any harm."
E ja es possible que·l budel sia liat am fiel subtil lo qual es fayt del budel de bestia annexs am lu, pus que es mes en agulha; e es que tu prenguas la extremitat de aquestz fiels de budel, e sia mot descarnat, e aprop lia la extremitat de lu am fiel de li, envolopat, e aprop entromet aquel fiel en agulhas e cos am aquel le budel, e areduzeys aquel en la disrupcio.	"And it is possible that the intestine may be ligated with a subtle thread made from the gut of an animal attached to it because it is more like a needle; and take the extremity of these intestinal threads, and let them be well cleaned, and appropriately ligate the extremity of it with thread of it wrapped around it, and appropriately insert that thread into needles and sew it with that intestine, reducing it in the disruption."
E aquesta manieyra de sutura am formiguas no es sino segon via de fiducia e d’esperansa.	"And this manner of suturing with figs is nothing but a way of trust and hope."
Mays si la plagua es gran e ampla, majorment si es en un dels budels subtils, quar lahoras no es engen sino subtiliacio, e no es sanacio de lu de tot.	"But if the wound is large and broad, especially if it is in one of the subtle intestines, for then there is nothing but subtiliation, and not healing of it altogether."
De curacio de zuchem e fistula.	"On the treatment of tumor and fistula."
Sapias que tota plagua e apostema quan se envilheseys e se Antiqua, e es fayt ulcus, e no es consolidat e geta braç tot temps e no es abscindit, lahoras, en qualque membre sia, universalment es nompnada fistula e nos la apelam aquela azukem.	"You should know that every wound and abscess when it becomes hollowed out and ancient, and is made into an ulcer, and does not consolidate and emits branch always without being cut off, then universally it is named fistula, and we call it that tumor."
E fistula segon veritat es nodacio feutrada, dura, blanqua am la qual no es dolor e a la qual es conquavitat ayssi cum es conquavitat de pena de ausel; e per aysso nompnat aquela alcus rizatz, id est pena.	"And truly, fistula is a hard, white, tough node without pain with which there is concavity just as there is concavity of the navel; and for this reason it is called that ulcerous boil, that is to say navel."
E es en alcus homes humida, la qual geta brac; e fort leu la humiditat es abscidida en alcunas horas.	"And in some people it is humid, which emits branch; and sometimes the humidity is cut off in a few hours."
E alcunas veguadas aquesta humiditat es mota, e es pauca, e es grossa, e es subtil.	"Sometimes this humidity is much, little, thick, and subtle."
E yeu ja he denant dit en la divisio, lahoras cum yeu diyssi las plaguas, que tot ulcus que no es sanat ni no es en lu nuda carn, no es aquo sino per una de ix causas: de las quals la una es o per pauquesa de sanc en le cos; o per malicia de lu; o quar entre lu e las labias es carn dura prohibent nativitat de carn; o quar es de mota legesa; o quar aquel ulcus en si meteys es poyrit e la materia que es a lu tramesa es de mala qualitat; o quar la medicina es enconvenient en la curacio de lu; o quan corrupcio catz en la regio, e es pestilencia; o per proprietat de regio ayssi cum endeve a Saragossa , en la qual es fayta difficil degestio de las malautias, e es tardada en aquela sanacio de apostema per natura; o quar en lu es os un, o motz osses.	"And I have already said before in the division when I spoke about wounds that every ulcer that is not healed nor on bare flesh, then it is nothing but for one of these causes: For lack of blood in the body; or because of the malice of it; or because between it and its lips there is hard flesh preventing the generation of flesh; or because it is too deep; or because that ulcer itself receives putrefaction and the matter that is sent to it is of bad quality; or because the medicine used for its cure is inconvenient; or when corruption arises in the region, and it is pestilence; or because of the property of the region such as happens in Saragossa where difficult digestion of illnesses occurs, and delay in that healing of abscess occurs naturally; or because there is a bone in it, or many bones."
Ja e mostrat totas aquelas causas, e·ls senhals de aquelas e la curacio de lor am medicinas en la divisio.	"I have already shown all those causes and the signs of them and their cure with medicines in the division."
E cove assi que yeu fassa a tu saber la curacio de fistula la qual es fayta per via de operacio am ma.	"And it is necessary that I make you know the treatment of fistula which is done by means of operation with a knife."
E sapias que fistula accideys en totz les membres del cos; quar de aquelas son fistulas que perveno a las venas grantz e arterias, o als nervis, o al ciphac, o al budel, o a la vesica, o ad alcuna de las costas, o ad alcu dels spondils del dos, o ad alcuna de las juncturas compostas per composicio ayssi quo de la ma e del pe; e de aquelas so que dan a lu propinquitat del membre principal e de semblantz.	"And you should know that fistula occurs in all the members of the body; for some of them pertain to the great veins and arteries, or to the nerves, or to the bladder, or to the intestine, or to the urinary bladder, or to one of the ribs, or to some of the vertebrae of the back, or to one of the joints composed by composition such as those of the hand and foot; and some of them have relation to the principal member and similar ones."
E donc aquela de aquestas fistulas que es segon aquesta manieyra es de las malautias de dificil sanacio, e no recep curacio, e occupacio am aquela es trebalh e ignorancia.	"And therefore those of these fistulas that are in this manner are among the illnesses of difficult healing and they do not receive cure and care with them is work and ignorance."
E si es de las fistulas alcuna la profunditat de la qual no perve ad aquestz locs que e dit, e esperas e confizas en la curacio de lu, e vols pervenir a cognicio de lu, lahoras pren tenta de eram o de ferr, e si la fistula va segon rectetut, e perquireys aquela am lu.	"And if there is any fistula whose depth does not reach those places that I have mentioned and you hope for its cure but you want to know about it, then take a thread of wool or iron, and if the fistula goes straight, examine it with it."
Mays si la fistula es tortuissitat, lahoras investigua aquela am tenta de plom subtil, quar plom am la levitat del sieu cors es alleujat e curvat deves la tortuositat.	"If the fistula is twisted, then examine it with a thin lead probe, for lead has the lightness of its body and curves towards the twist."
E si la fistula es havent motz horrificis, no es a tu possible que signifiques sobre lu am tenta.	"And if the fistula is without any movement or horror, you will not be able to designate anything by means of it."
Adonc cristeriza le orrifici per sos orrificis, quar la humiditat per la qual clisterizas aquela va deves las autras orrificis e corr de lor.	"Then crystallize the horrifics for their own sake, because the moisture with which you crystalize them will flow towards the other horrifics and run from them."
E aprop inquier exquisitament, segon qual manieyra a tu es possible que conoguas si aqui has os o nervi, e es la conquavitat de la fistula longinqua o propdana, o es una fistula a la qual so motz orrificis e esta sobre aquo tot am la suma de la tua fortaleza, am la tua enterroguacio, am la qual enterroguas le malaute, e la invencio de la dolor deves la tua compressio am la ma sobre le loc, e semblantz de las significacios e de las causas accidentz al apostema.	"And inquire meticulously in what manner you can recognize if here are the os or nerves, and whether the concavity of the fistula is distant or nearby, or if it is a fistula to which its movements are horrifics and situated above all with your utmost strength, your enteroquery, by which you enteroquery the illness, and discover the cause of pain under your compression with the hand on the location, and similar meanings and accidental causes of the apostema."
E cum tu auras stat sobre totas aquelas causas am stacio veraya, lahoras ve a la curacio segon confidencia: e es que tu consideras lahoras si es fistula apparent propinqua o en loc sal, longinqua de junctura, o de nervi, o de arteria, o de vena, o de un dels locs les quals yeu a tu e ditz.	"And after having stood over all those causes with true steadfastness, then go to the cure according to your confidence: and it is that you consider now whether the fistula appears nearby or in a healthy place, distant from junction, nerves, arteries, veins, or any of the places which I have mentioned to you."
Lahoras tu secca la fistula segon que denant es dit de la naracio de lu, e osta aquo que es en aquela filtracio e de carns corrumpudas, e aquo que es nascut en le orrifici de la carn, o de theil e de semblantz, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	"Then dry the fistula according to what has been said about its narration earlier, and remove what is present in that filtration and of rotting flesh, and whatever is born from the horror of the flesh, or of theil and similar things, and cure it until it is healed."
Mays si la fistula es de longinqua profunditat, e es segon rectetut, lahoras cove que inscidas aquela en le preon atant quant a tu sira possible, e aprop mondifica aquela de totas las suas carns corrompudas; e aprop administra calguas envolopadas en medicinas acutas, e intromet aquelas entro a la conquavitat de la fistula, la qual has conprenduda am ferr.	"But if the fistula is of distant depth and is rectitudinary, then you should insert it into the pron at least as far as possible for you, and properly cleanse it from all its rotting flesh; and properly administer hot compresses wrapped in sharp medicines, and introduce them into the concavity of the fistula which you have comprehended with iron."
E fay aquo am aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la medicina acuta corroda tot aquo que es romas en la conquavitat de la fistula de la corrupcio.	"And do this several times until the sharp medicine burns everything that is rough in the concavity of the fistula from corruption."
E aprop restaura aquela am enguentz les quals engendran carn sana entro que sia sanada.	"And properly restore it with ointments which generate healthy flesh until it is healed."
Mays si no es sanada per aquo, lahoras tu cauteriza aquela segon que havem recomtat.	"But if it is not healed by this, then cauterize it according to what we have recommended."
Mays si la causa de fistula es os e es deves tu certificat aquo, lahoras tu inquireys aquela e secca aquela segon que havem recomtat, si tu no prohibeys alcuna causa de vena o de nervi o de membre principal ayssi cum havem dit.	"But if the cause of the fistula is bone and you are certain about this, then examine it and dry it according to what we have recommended, provided that you do not prohibit any cause of vein or nerve or main member as we have said."
Mays si le os es a tu descubert e es en lu alcuna corrupcio e negror, lahoras tu ratz aquel entro que la corrupcio sia hostada tota; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que lu encarne entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is visible to you and there is some corruption and blackness in it, then scrape that until all corruption has been removed; and properly cure it with whatever makes flesh grow until it is healed."
E si no es sana e gieta brac ayssi cum fazia, lahoras sapias que tu no est pervengut a la eradicacio tota de la corrupcio; e adonc tu descuebre sobre lu segondanament e exquisitament fay la razio de lu e la mundificacio de lu am la deriera fortalasa tieua, e aprop restaura aquel.	"And if it does not heal and throws out matter as it did before, then know that you have not reached the complete eradication of corruption; therefore uncover it carefully and search its cause thoroughly and perform the last cleansing with your strongest forceps, and properly restore it."
E donc si es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras sapias que aquela corrupcio es en la profunditat longinqua del cors, la qual no ha conseguida, e adonc a tu en aquel no es engen sino laysar aquela.	"And therefore if it is healed, good. But if not, then know that that corruption is in the distant depth of the body, which has not been reached, and therefore in that case there is nothing else to do but leave it alone."
E si le os corromput es petit, o es a tu possible atirar aquel, lahora tu le atira am forceps subtils las quals conveno ad aquo.	"And if the corrupted bone is small or can be removed by you, then remove it with subtle forceps which are suitable for that."
E si so motz osses, lahoras exquisitament fay la extraccio de totz aquels, e de aquels no laysses denguna causa am la tua fortaleza.	"And if there are many bones, then carefully perform the extraction of all of them, and do not leave any cause behind with your strength."
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat alcuna causa de las humiditatz, e en lor inscizio no ha temor ni error, lahoras inscideys aquelas liaments o carns si so aqui, e deliura les osses.	"But if there is any resistance caused by humidity and there is no fear or error in its incision, then incise those membranes or flesh if they are present, and deliver the bones."
Mays si a tu no es preparacio de ostar les osses de la tua hora, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua aquo que poyresca la plagua aquela, e layssa aquela entro que aquo es al enviro de aquels osses de carns e de liamentz, e guarda la plagua que no sia consolidada, e sia constrengida la seccio la qual tu has inscidida en la tua operacio.	"But if there is no preparation to remove the bones at that time, then place a plug over the wound and pack it with material which will preserve the wound. Leave this in place until the flesh and membranes have grown around the bones, and keep the plug from becoming consolidated, and strengthen the section which you have incised during your operation."
Habantz, si temes, pausa sobre lu coto submers en sopre trissat am oli, o coto submers en anguent egipciac, o en alcu dels enguentz vertz, quar quan poyriran aquelas liaments, e les osses son de lor seperatz la ablacio, e de aquels atraccio es alleujada.	"Then if you fear that the wound may collapse, pack it underwater with olive oil or Egyptian pitch or one of the green ointments, for when those membranes and flesh have grown together, they separate from the bones and attraction is alleviated."
Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	"But if it is a large bone like the thighbone or shinbone or similar ones, and only the surface of it is corrupted, then scrape that with a curette alone until that blackness and corruption has been removed, and properly restore the plug."
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	"But if a large part of it is corrupted and corruption has reached the marrow of the bone, then it is necessary to close that wound and incise it entirely until the point where corruption has reached. Then cure it until consolidation occurs."
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	"And I recommend to you that which is necessary for a man in his thighbone so that you place that on it as an example and assistant during your operation."
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	"A young man about thirty years old happened to have pain in his thighbone, and the cause of the pain was inside the bone marrow where there was an abscess with a large amount of pus, and it was not caused by any external factor."
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	"And thus much time passed with that due to the error of doctors in that they suppressed the abscess until a great amount of matter accumulated. Then its treatment was properly begun when the thighbone had been fistulated, and many orifices were made in it which all discharged pus and humidity from the body."
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	"And then a multitude of doctors treated him for about two years, but they did not know more in that art than I was called."
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	"And when I saw the thighbone of him and the matter that flowed out of those orifices for a long distance, then his whole body was already weakened and his complexion was yellowish."
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	"And therefore I inserted my finger into one of those orifices and reached the bone."
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	"And then I examined all of the orifices thoroughly and found that they originated from all parts of the thighbone."
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	"And then I opened and incised over one of those orifices until I discovered a part of the bone, which was rotten and corrupted and black. And already a part of the thighbone had penetrated into the muscle."
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	"And then I showed what I had discovered and prepared from that exposed bone to others."
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	I believe that the sentence translates to: "And I knew it was not in the bone but rather that corruption which I had opened and closed, and I had already drained it."
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	"And accordingly, I paused the restoration of the disease through medicine, consolidated for a long time, and not yet consolidated."
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	"And likewise, I explored and discovered on the bone secondarily on the first discovery, and found continuous corruption with the bone."
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	"And I closed what appeared to me of that corruption, and accordingly I prepared to make the cure and restoration, but it was not restored."
E adonc yeu descubri sobre lu autra veguada e no cessegui inscidir le os petit a petit particuladament e perforsa la restauracio de lu, e no es restaurat entro que inscidigui entorn un palm de lu, e aquel extraxi am la medula sua, e aprop restauregui aquel am medicinas, e es consolidat leugierament e sanat.	"And then you discovered it again and did not cease incising the bone little by little particularly and prepared for its restoration, but it was not restored until you incised around a palm of it, and that extracted with its marrow, and accordingly restored it with medicines, and it is lightly consolidated and healed."
E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala.	"And there is no need for iteration in the operation of it and section of it except for the disposition of its frivolity and for its poverty of tolerance and fear of its death, because it has sloth in all hours due to superfluous evacuation, fainting, and evil."
E donc sanat es per sanacio entiera, e nada es en loc de os carn dura; e es fayta bona la disposicio de lu en le sieu cors e retornec la vertut de lu; e es conversat en las suas disposicios e no fec a lu contrarietat en ambulacio ni nocument en denguna causa.	"And therefore, it is healed by whole healing, and nothing remains in place of hard flesh; its disposition is good in its body and returns its virtue to it; it has been converted into its dispositions and does not do anything contrary to it in motion nor any harm in any cause."
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	"But if it is prominent in place of the body already broken, then you should cut that according to this manner: and it is that you take linen and strengthen that at the extremity of that prominent bone, and command someone to extend that under them; and pause that first linen with a thicker second linen; and accordingly bind that over the flesh that is on the sides of the bone, and extend the extremity of it so that you draw the flesh towards the sides, and uncover the flesh upon the place which you wish to saw, so that the saw does not harm the flesh."
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	"And pause a board or table underneath the bone appropriately, because when you do this it is forbidden that the saw not cut corrupt flesh."
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	"And it is necessary that the sawing be upon the corrupt place little by little, because if it is in the concavity of the corruption and does not appear in its appearance to the touch, then it will be necessary to saw it again."
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	"And if the bone is corrupted and not prominent, then it is one continuous part joined to another, and the corruption is in the middle place or in a part of it. Then uncover the flesh from all parts; pause wood underneath; saw that from the first part where the corruption is entered until the sawing continues into the other part."
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	"And let the sawing be according to the place of the corruption a little, as we have said."
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	"And if the corruption is at the joint, then cut that corrupt joint; saw the bone where it continues from the other part."
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	"But if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in its reason but accidental."
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	"And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, you should inquire about the corruption in whatever way appears to you and cut that away and clean that according to every disposition which is possible for you, and with each device be corrected by you when it does not do any harm to vein or nerve."
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	"And know which are the cutting tools and saws to cut these bones are many according to the situation of the bones, and their preparation, their thickness, subtlety and grandeur and smallness, hardness and rarity; because you should prepare all kinds of appropriate instruments for that operation."
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	"And know that this operation signifies to you concerning the kind of instrument which you need; because if you have great study and long knowledge and experience in the methods of this art, and testimony of the methods of illnesses, then already you would know for yourself what is convenient for each instrument for every illness."
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	"And I give you here at the end of this chapter the number of instruments which you should prepare with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experience on others."
Forma de serra:	"Form of saw:"
Forma de autra serra:	"Form of another saw:"
Forma de autra serra:	"Form of another saw:"
Forma de autra serra gran:	"Form of large saw:"
Forma de ray:	"Form of rasp:"
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	"And let the head of this rasp be in the form of a star-shaped key head, and its points be in the shape of astragalus points."
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	"And it is not convenient that with this [instrument] are rubbed the heads of joints when they are corrupted or if the mouth is large and wide."
Forma de razori major dels autres:	"Form of a larger razor than the others:"
Forma de razori menor:	"Form of smaller razor:"
Forma de razori lat:	"Form of wide razor:"
Forma de serra autra decentment fayta: sia fayt arc de lu pus sobira e la acuitat de lu de ferr, e le membre de lu de boys punhal descentment fayt.	"Form of another saw appropriately made: let it be made in the shape of a bow as high and sharp as iron, and its member made of soft wood well formed."
Forma de lu:	"Form of it:"
Forma de razori en la qual ha concavitat:	"Form of razor with concavity:"
Forma de razori autra subtil:	"Form of another fine razor:"
Forma de autra razori de curvada extremitat:	"Form of another razor with curved end:"
Forma de rasori petit semblant a tenta:	"Form of small knife similar to an awl:"
Forma de incisori am le qual so inscidit les osses:	"Form of cutter used for cutting bones:"
Forma de inscisori autra minor:	"Form of another smaller cutter:"
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	"Form of another cutter: this is similar to a rasp, and its end is like a saw, used in many places concerning the bones:"
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	"Form of rasp suitable for use on that which has been bored into the bones:"
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	"And its end is triangular and sharp-pointed."
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	"And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly all the forms that we have said concerning razors, cutters, and saws."
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	"Of cutting off extremities and sawing bones."
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	"Extremities can be removed either due to an intrinsic cause or extrinsic cause, or when you have treated that corruption with curative medicines and the cure does not confer, sometimes the corruption goes into a member which does not persecute any cause; therefore it is necessary for you to cut off that member within which the corruption has occurred, because the illness will disappear through that of death or malice which is greater damage to the member."
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	"And the sign of that which occurs is that member becomes black within which it was covered with corruption or burning, or putrefaction appears there within which it enters that member and takes all the body; therefore cut off that with cutting."
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	"And similarly if corruption is caused by percussion of some venomous causes such as that of the sea scorpion, viper or rattle snake and similar things."
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	"And if the corruption or percussion is at the extremity of the finger, then you cut off the finger and do not give space for the corruption to go into the hand."
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	"And similarly if it occurs in the hand, then you cut off that at the wrist joint and do not give space for corruption to take hold of the forearm."
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	"And if it happens instead, then cut off the arm just above the elbow at the joint."
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	"And if corruption passes beyond that and sometimes envelops the elbow, then in that case there is death from illness; and to administer another cause for cure besides this is just quantity of virtue."
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	"And similarly concerning the foot when corruption happens at the toe of the foot, then cut it off within one of the joints."
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	"And if it takes hold on the heel of the foot, then cut off all the foot."
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	If it can enter the anus, then incise the skin at the junction of the anus.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already reached the rectum, then it is not removal but release, and let the patient die.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	The method of incising the member or severing it is that you stretch the ligament at the part where you want to cut, and then stretch another ligament above the location. The minister should extend one ligament on each side of the place to be cut, and the other minister should extend another ligament above them. Then you separate the flesh between the two ligaments with a wide-bladed knife until all the flesh is exposed. Then it can be incised or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	It is necessary to bind the limbs on all sides so that they do not touch the location where it will be operated on, and that the patient suffers only just injury and a clean wound.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if bleeding occurs while operating, then cauterize the location carefully, or apply some powder made from dry red roses to stop the bleeding. Then return to your treatment until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the member gently with a bandage in whatever way seems convenient, and take care of it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you that once happened to a man on his foot, this accident which you and I are discussing, which is that it occurred due to the blackness of the skin on his foot caused by burning similar to fire combustion.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption first began in his toe and then spread throughout the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Then that man prepared himself to apply pus every day since the treatment had not been effective in relieving the pain and burning sensation of the member. He incised the foot at its joint, and it healed with fire cauterization.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	It has happened for a long time that that corruption comes into the tip of the finger.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it came to me, and I realized that that excess water had gathered on the hand with which I handled medications, precisely during the cleansing of the patient's body. And the excess water did not recede, but began to flow into another finger starting from the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he asked me to lance his hand, but I did not want to do so hoping that the excess water would recede. Indeed, I feared for the incision of his hand because the disease's strength was too great.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he parted from me, he returned to his land and it came to my knowledge that that man prepared himself and incised his own hand entirely, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I do not tell you this story except to aid those who may be afflicted with this disease, and that there may be meaning in it for the one to whom it is told and according to which it should be acted upon.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	De cura sinusum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an aposteme occurs on some fleshy member and the space of the aposteme is prolonged until it makes collection of pus, and then it breaks and perforates, and the pus comes out from it, and the place remains empty as if it were a vessel, and the cord that is over it appears thus like a subtly woven cloth, and there has not been any later corruption, and it does not impress on the bone or on nerve nor on ligament, it is called sinus, and it is not called fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But if the space is prolonged until corruption impresses on some member, then it is called fistula and not sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure for it is to incise that cord entirely as it appears, and more so when it is thin like cloth, and you make sure that it does not adhere to the place by its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you wait for the cord to adhere and that corruption has not yet had its final course, and there has appeared a passage in the cord, then you treat it with a clyster.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And when you examine the sinus, if it is large and the arm that extends from it has a fetid odor, then you clysterize it with Egyptian medicine which is made of oil and sour wine and salt receipt in equal parts, ground fine and adjusted in a vessel, and cooked over the fire until the medicine becomes thick like honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it the amount that is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and you clysterize with that the sinus, and strengthen the opening of it, and leave the medicine in it for the duration of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then you extract that with a probe; and do this for so many days until the sinus is cleaned out and the pus is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is clysterized with water of ash when this medicine is not present; and you take the ashes of oak wood, put them on the water, then boil them and clysterize that with it until you are sure that the sinus has been cleaned out.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient cannot tolerate the Egyptian medicine nor the water of ash, then you clysterize it with water and honey mixed together three times, and you also clysterize it with wine and honey mixed together, because honey has the property to cleanse and wash, and wine makes the sinus adhere more, especially when there is an excess of astringency and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you do this several times and you are sure that the sinus has been removed, then you clysterize it with something that makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you take of the powder called diafinicon and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine, or you clysterize it with other medicines and ointments that have the properties which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the opening of the sinus is narrow and cannot receive the cannula of the clyster, then you dilate it with a small iron probe little by little, and pause in it with cotton wrapped in Egyptian ointment or basilicon ointment until it has been dilated.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the opening is wide, then you close its lips with a suture and leave in it the amount that intervenes between the clyster without adding anything else.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening of that from which the arm extends is elevated above the parts around it, then you close it with a bitumen plaster in such a way that the arm runs within it, because when the arm is tightened by the pressure of the sinus flesh will be generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if you cannot close the sinus with bitumen plaster as you wish, then you make an incision into the member after preparing it in such a way that the arm runs out of it lightly according to what seems appropriate to you and without anything inside it that could impede the movement of the arm.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take medicines that are consolidating, put them on a cloth, and apply them to the sinus as you wish to extend them over it.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of such a size that it covers all of the sinus; and then you incise with forceps on the right side of the opening of the sinus a small slit slightly wider than the opening of the sinus, and then you apply over another cloth of linen ointments of the lions according to the size of the slit, and put it on that for a distant position from the opening of the sinus so that the exit of the arm from it is relieved and the cloth does not stick too much but rather just once every few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is on the opening of the sinus should be removed immediately in order to remove whatever may have adhered to it from the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if what comes out of it from the arm is much or little, whether it is digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And also consider the location of that sinus, whether the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is an abscess.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment has lasted for a while in this manner and you see that the matter that is poured onto the opening of the sinus has already adhered or almost adhered, then on the third day remove it by tearing it off gently; and when you tear it off, then change the cloth for another one and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinus a long distance virus subtile issues forth, then do not despair of its adhesion, because the healing of it will occur, because there are some people in whom the generation of flesh is late in their wounds, and among those who the opposite occurs.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if for many days an undigested arm comes out of the sinus, then you know that the sinus does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the sinus is delayed and the cause is prolonged, then you should apply dry medicines, and if the medicines are moist in their substance and virtue, they will be dry like diafinicon ointment when there is an excess of addition of egg yolk.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last remedy that remains is to take diafinicon ointment and dissolve it in rose oil, then add old wine to it in its substance, and apply it on top of it, and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And do likewise in that action when there is no arm coming out of it: apply diafinicon ointment, honey when it has been cooked until thickened, and use it; or take myrrh and aloe and frankincense, grind everything and powder it over the honey while it is on the fire, then mix this onto a cloth and apply it on top of the sinus; and also apply that honey which you have cooked until thickened, powder it onto a cloth and apply it.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	"Sometimes a long-armed plaster made of celestial lily (and it is called celestial lily) and ground barley and centaurea is administered."
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	"If the pain persists and is not healed by this treatment, you should know that the corruption is in the patient's throat. Then, make an investigation into the bones or other hard members or the ligaments."
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	"For the treatment of pimples and scratched nails, and for adding an extra digit and cutting it off."
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	"A pimple is an aposteme that appears on the nail of the thumb or toe, and if it grows and its treatment is less cared for, it becomes an aposteme of cauterized aposteme, or corrupted. It emits a dark red liquid that corrode the root of the nail, and sometimes it corrupts the whole of it, and sometimes its corruption reaches the bone, causing foul odor, and the tip of the finger turns black and its color becomes dark."
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	"And therefore, when you have that with what we have said in the division and your treatment does not improve, then it is necessary for you to incise with iron all the superfluity that remains of the nail, and cauterize the wound immediately afterwards, because cautery is very helpful in this case."
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	"But if the bone is healthy and the nail is sound, but the additions of the nail begin to penetrate into the flesh inside, and start to sting and hurt it, then you should cut a thin ray from the angle of the nail that pierces the flesh, push it up, and incise that flesh easily, and apply onto what remains of the flesh remedies made of corrosive substances until it is completely removed; and immediately afterwards, cure it with ointment until it is healed."
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	"But if the corruption has already reached the bone, then you should incise the bone and remove it, because there is no time when something corrupt in the bone can be healed."
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	"And if sometimes the corrosion and corruption reach the finger, then you should incise it in one of its joints according to how far it has progressed, and immediately afterwards cure it until it is healed."
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	"But if the nail receives percussion or friction and there is sharp pain in it, then you should first apply a flebotomy to the affected area, and immediately afterwards dry the nail with a fine spatula made with a transverse section from top to bottom, making sure that the section does not reach the flesh underneath the nail, because you will cause sharp pain and cause the formation of excess flesh in that location; and immediately afterwards cure that location with something that relieves pain."
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	"But this (ailment), which is found in most men, is characterized by the fact that it is very fleshy and very bloody, either in the bones or in the nails."
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	"And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or their origin is in some joints of these fingers."
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	"But those that are born in some joints of the finger are not painful, and those that are born at the joints are very painful."
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	"And those that are born fleshy have a thin section, and you should incise them at their root with a wide spatula."
